text:
Went there for Mother's day,  party of 3 around 9pm. First time customers, we all did the AYCE. Sushi and side dishes came out pretty quick.  Side dishes were great,  sushi was good but I've had better. My son didn't care for the uni,  as it is one of his favorites. Just the quality and lack of taste wasn't up to par for him. He ordered one of the rolls with crunchies but it tasted stale. My husband who likes spicy sms hot couldn't handle the 911 roll. The spicy tuna was great but it was an even toss up of good and not so good rolls.
No sashimi (but most ayce don't have), No raw oysters (again usually you don't see that for ayce). That's okay I have my favorite spot where I get both in the ayce. 
I love sweets and the bonus is that you are not limited to one dessert only.  So I really enjoyed the lychee sorbet,  mochi ice cream and tempura ice cream.
The service was good, around enough to take orders and clear plates.  They just never offer refills,  even when our cup is empty we had to ask for the refills. 
I would go back,  but not a big deal if I don't make it.

I came here once and never again.

As good as the sushi was, there were roaches crawling up the walls and the employees were aware of the roaches on the walls and stood idly by doing nothing. I call health hazard because now I wonder if those creepy critters actually got into the food and could potentially get customers sick. 

If you want to eat sushi go elsewhere. DO NOT COME HERE!!!

Okay so went there for lunch today for the first time. I've been to the Maryland location and they were great and nice.
Sushi chef was nice at saraha location. 
Their tuna was kind of weird texture but other then that food was good. 
I liked their masago roll, moon rool, and garlic edemame.
The reason I give them 2 stars is because the manager charged me for literary not eating a HALF OF A SPOON of RICE I almost wanted to laugh it wasn't even a whole one peice of sushi. He wasn't nice at all about it. 
I probably wont be going back to that location just because of him.

The place smells when you walk in. Sushi was mediocre to average. Some of the more specialty nigiri (garlic tuna, seared salmon) is also topped with a ponzu sauce that makes everything fall apart and way too salty. Spider roll was also very salty. Shrimp tempura was good. Service was not bad when I was there. For a good off the strip AYCE sushi option I suggest JJANGA, which has better sushi and is a dollar cheaper.

Went to this place based off a friends recommendation, and was extremely disappointed. The menu has no variety and everything was pretty basic. No wow factor  The dining area is also fairly small, luckily we went midday so there wasn't a wait. Probably won't go back.

This used to be one of my favorite sushi restaurants, and I would eat there once a week, but not anymore. The old owners took a lot of pride in treating the customers well and serving high quality sushi. since it was sold, the décor might be improved but the customer service and food quality stinks! They scrimp on the servings and the service. Also,I went there on a Tuesday night, after the main dinner crowd had left.  Only 2 tables were filled with customers and they refused to seat me at any table but a tiny one facing into a corner.  I am glad there are a lot of Sushi Restaurant choices on the west side, I've taken my business elsewhere.

Just starting coming here with my parents because we love Tony!!! He is amazing always hooks us up with delicious fish and awesome sauces. I love the spicy ponzu sauce he makes. Only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because its sooo small.

I've been back a couple of times since the new ownership, and things are getting better, so I'm giving them one more star.  The service has improved, and they have brought back some of the old chefs.   Worth a visit.   But sure wish the new owner wouldn't hover around the sushi bar, looking like he wants to make sure the chefs don't serve too much fish.
Yum! Maybe not 5 star but for the price it can't be beat. Plus, with 2 hungry teenage boys we have to do AYCE!

Fresh fish, lots of options. They used to have very slow service but I find they have corrected that issue the last few times I have gone. Definitely a go to for ayce sushi. Try the orgasm salad, spicy albacore Nigiri, and the crunchy rice w spicy Tuna.
Everything is fresh and yummy!  Love the deserts!  We will definitely come back next time!!
Teriyaki chicken was disgusting. I had heard good things about this place. I was terribly disappointed. I won't ever go back.

One star for having roaches and poor service. 

First time trying out this location with my boyfriend. (He's tried the one on Maryland and loved it; we go to Goyemon -my favorite, on Decatur all the time).

Sat around for ten minutes at the bar before we ordered some rolls (AYCE of course). The rolls took a while to be made (very slow in comparison to all other AYCE sushi restaurants) especially considering how many customers were dining. It was just us, another couple, and one other lady. Luckily I eat pretty slow so I wasn't kept waiting too long between rolls. My boyfriend, however, really had to slow down his pace and did have to wait for new rolls. Btw, there were four sushi chefs working behind the bar. You definitely need to order as much as you can when you figure out what you want or else you will be waiting a while for your food to come. 

The server didn't come and take the drink order until after our food already came. Again, keep in mind that they made the rolls relatively slow (and we only made two nigiri and two half roll orders). So we were already eating by the time she brought our two waters. 

Skip to the end of the meal...after we order dessert we notice a baby roach crawling on the menu right in front of us on the bar. We didn't make a big deal (as gross as it was); my boyfriend just squished its guts out with his napkin. But to make matters worse, when we were brought our bill, they charged us for dinner instead of lunch. We brought it to their attention that we were already seated by 3:50 (dinner doesn't start until 4:00 and we weren't going to pay an extra $10 when we didn't even order any dinner specials -namely the green tea creme brûlée  which I love). The server then came back and informed us that their computer said that we came in at 4:10 and that's when I called bull. I specifically remembered looking at the clock when we got our waters and it was 4:07. Again, we waited forever for our drinks, and if we got the drinks at 4:07 then how the hell did we walk in and get seated at 4:10? They finally decided to CORRECT the bill from dinner to lunch, but our whole experience was already ruined at that point. Will definitely not be making a return to this restaurant.
The best bang for your buck. The all you can eat is definitely worth it if you can eat a lot. Recommendation : sexy girl is so goood it's a must if your in the area if not, it's worth the drive.

Friendly staff. Fast service. Clean and welcoming atmosphere. Delicious food.
When my friend and I sat down to eat the guy making the sushi was very accommodating and helpful. He suggested very satisfying items on the menu and kept very interactive making it a very enjoyable visit!

This is my favorite sushi place in Vegas. The food is simple and fresh with a nice sized piece of fish on each nigiri. While some of the nigiri and rolls have sauces, they don't overpower the fish at all. So many other sushi places rely on their sauce, not quality of fish. Since they've been under new management, the quality has gone up. We typically do AYCE, but if we don't, we get a sashimi dinner...so good and reasonably priced.

The food is incredible and super fast take out service! I would eat here everyday!! 

The sushi is very fresh and nicely displayed. The staff at this restaurant are fabulous!

To be honest I gerneally do not make it out to that side of town, although I had a friend working over there and decided to meet her for dinner. With that being said, I arrived early (which is unusual for me) although once there they would not allow me to get a table till our entire party was there. Which placed me sitting akwardly in front of the door in everyones way, rather than at the table. Not happy about this already. The sushi was not necessarily bad, although there was nothing fantastic about it either. All you can eat makes sense when you have a large party... When time to leave our checks were wrong and they could not straighten it out, so we just paid and left. I am just not at big fan! Most likely not going to go back. (Mainly because my regular sushi place is closer, cleaner, better quality of food, and more inviting.) Not to horrible but I don't suggest it. That's just my honest review. Good day.

This is an amazing sushi restaurant! Fast service, quality food, and friendly staff! Thank you for one hell of a Sunday lunch. I recommend the hurricane roll, sexy girl roll, and the super white tuna!

Sushi Mon have become our default sushi place. We always do ayce lunch and order a lot of nigiris. The fish were as fresh as you could hope for here in vegas -- comparable to goyemon (another favorite sushi place). Their rolls were good though none stands out -- but they will make you custom rolls which is great! Aside from our usual nigiris: super white tuna, yellow tail, salmon, eel, red snapper; we always order: frying jason, volcano, dragon roll, mussels, orgasmic salad and whatever else is on the daily special board. They have a more extensive (with grilled fish) dinner menu so its also worth going there for dinner but 808 sushi offers more grilled fish than sushi mon so thats where we go if we feel like having sushi/grilled fish for dinner.

Sushi Mon's service was great and friendly. We get our orders without noticing how long it has been... And we order a lot to get our money's worth! The flow of food coming our way was exceptional and they always refill our teas. The place is small enough that wait staff always see you if you're trying to get their attention. 

One thing i will always come back here for is their lychee sherbet!!! There's not a lot of restaurants here that serve lychee sherbet... its always worth the drive to have a little of this treat!
Ulysses the waitress gave us a vip attention, was kind, did our dinner a beautiful  experience,  thanks Ulysses

good food, but service was slow.
in general not bad place but if venue is slow, then service should up to par.
AYCE here is okay. Service is okay, but the sushi quality is okay.

My husband and I have had dinner here a few times.  We love the food and atmosphere, so we decided to go again on our 1st year wedding anniversary, last night.  We were seated at a table, since the sushi bar was full.  Once we were waited on, I noticed the waiter was sort of rushed to take our order.  After our first round, of the "All you can eat" deal, the waiter quickly came around and asked if we wanted dessert.  He kept rushing us by asking the same question each time he came back to our table.  Then shortly after he placed the bill on our table. And again, kept coming back to the table to check if we had paid the bill.  This all within 30min of being seated.  We understood there is a time limit, but found it quite rude to have the waiter continuously lifting up the bill to check if we had paid it.  After about 4x of this, I explained to the waiter we would pay at the register, he insisted on having us pay at the table bc they need to clear the table for the next guests.  Meanwhile my husband, still chewing his food, I asked the waiter if my husband could at least finish eating. The waiter then turned and walked away. We received a dismissive apology when we told the cashier we were rushed out of our table.  At least my husband finished his last bite, walking out the door I guess.  Worst. Service. Ever.
Great sushi place off the strip!! Lots of vegan options! My fav rolls are the natto roll n the supreme veggie roll! N it's open late!!

Workers here stare at you while you eat to make sure you are really eating your rice with your sushi. We went as soon as they open for lunch and today's special Kanpachi was written on the board, but then when we ordered 5 of those, they said they don't have any more and erased from the board. After we came out, I saw them writing Kanpachi on the board again. Foods tasted alright. Don't do the all-you-can-eat if you are so concerned about how much we eat. We were not satisfied to come back.

One of my favorite sushi places. The all you can eat prices are really low during lunch and pretty decent during dinner time. All of their rolls taste amazing. I have been to this location and the other one time each. I can't help but say this is the best place to eat sushi. The chefs are kind of slow, especially when busy, that would be their only reason I wouldn't give them a 5 star rating. Other than that.. They offered great customer service the servers made sure my drink were always filled and they always checked to see if we needed something from the actual kitchen, because on the all you can eat menu they didn't have just sushi. You could order teriyaki chicken bowls, rice, poki, and other stuff. The Takoyaki (fried Octopus Ball) was really good not the best but it was pretty good! One of my favorite roll would have been the Dragon roll (California roll with eel on top and eel sauce) it was amazing. I would go back again. If you can eat a lot I recommend going here during lunch and getting the all you can eat you won't be disappointed.

I had been here once before which the customer service was a lot better I think it was because we were being attended by the Sushi chefs. I went in recently again decided to take my cousin from LA to go have some all you can eat which turned out to be a nightmare the waitress brought us out our 1st order when we where going to order more she looked at my cousins plate and told her she had to eat that and pointed, we did'nt notice anything because we finished everything she came over again and got the plate and pointed at literaly 5 pieces of rice grains and told her again she had to eat that before ordering more well she did so we ordered more and finally it was time for dessert I dont eat sweets but my 6yr old son kept asking for Mango Mochi being that its included in the all you can eat I figured sure no problem as long as it get's eaten well here she comes again heard my son say "mommy mango mochi" she looked at me and said "he cannot eat the ice cream" I said "excuse me? it's included in my all you can eat as long as it gets eaten there shouldnt be any problem it's not like I was feeding my kid sushi he had his own order of teryaki." she said "Those are the rules"  I told her to just bring it to me but she was waiting for me to say he wasnt going to eat it before she brought it I did not say that because the DAMN ICE CREAM was for my son not me. HORRIBLE service I get the all you can eat rules but this lady went overboard which cost her, her tip.

This is our go-to sushi place! We've tried many, and although most are good, this one just has everything we could possibly want. Huge selection, every possible combination, and they all work out awesome. My favorites are the stacey, the pastel and the j.j. Do leave some room for dessert (yep, you read me!). The lychee sorbet is incredible, the green tea creme brulee is to die for, don't get me started on the mochi ice cream, and chocolate mousse and ... I'll stop typing right now and head there! It is a terrific place!
Good service!!! The fish were fresh!!'  Most importantly, fast!!! Definitely will come back!

I ate here a lot until a recent experience.  There seems to be a shift in the quality and service from the past. There were new slow inexperienced servers now unlike before. I usually get AYCE and never had any issues.  Now they are like sushi nazi's. Watching the clock to make sure you don't order anything even a minute past your allowed time, trying to charge me for one piece of uneaten sushi from a roll I didn't really care for, I felt the eyes looking at us making sure my girlfriend who didn't get AYCE didn't have any of my order, etc.  they also seemed to disappear after my first round of ordering trying to allow the clock to run down, and limit the amount of sushi I could order in the time frame.  All in all it seems like they are out to save as much money, and pinch all the  pennies as possible (scary with a sushi restaurant). I also had a frequent AYCE card that was filled up and ready to use for a free meal. I had no idea, but it had expired the day before. They refused to accept it!  

I won't be going there anymore, and they lost a loyal customer.  They saved a penny, but only to loose a dollar.
Pretty average sushi spot. Spider roll very good though, nicely crisped soft shell crab. Service very pleasant and generally quick. Too many other good places for sushi to prompt a return visit.

We went for lunch and passed on the AYCE, so I do not know what that experience would have been like but it seems a common theme amongst many reviews here. 
Ordering off the menu was a fine, the combination box offered chicken, tuna, salmon, California roll, tempura, rice, salad and miso soup. Sushi was very tasty and the drinks menu reasonably priced.
The spot was well frequented by locals, always a good sign for out of town visitors like my group.
Atmosphere pretty plain, we sat at one of the few tables that feel squeezed in. 
Contrary to other reviews we saw only Japanese sushi chefs working behind the bar.
We saw the ACYE option during lunch, the dinner menu offers more options than the lunch. Given the rather strict rules including the 45 minute time limit, I doubt we would have tried it anyway.

AYCE. 60 minutes to chow down. The 911 roll is ridiculously spicy. It warns you on the menu, but oh man. My entire mouth was on fire. I also had the orion roll. Very tasty. The staff was slow to come back and get our order, but as our stay continued the service picked up. My husband wasn't impressed with his tuna roll. He felt like it had been made and was sitting out.  However he loved his spam roll and his deep fried California roll. All in all a pretty successful dinner.

My husband and I have been coming here for almost 2 years almost weekly. The last two times we came the service was SO slow. We were actually there for an hour yesterday and got 1 roll each. We were told they hadn't even started making our other food yet. When we got there it was dead slow! About 20 minutes in it got very busy. That's fine it's busy. But if I'm waiting an hour for rolls they shouldn't be falling apart as I pick them up. It was awful. We finally just paid for what we had received so far and cancelled our other order. 90 minutes total we were there. $25 check with no tip left and my husband and I each ate a single roll. We will not be coming back.

I went there to treat a good friend of mine to an all you can eat sushi.  I have always been pleased of the service there in the past.  Tonight, it was by far the worse customer service I have ever had in an AYCE sushi.  The waitress on more than one occasion kept telling us to eat our food and finish it!  She was hesitant to take our order and looked at our food every time we ordered and reminded us AGAIN to eat all that we ordered!!!  Obviously, I told her that I have been there before and know their rules!

I was disappointed this visit. It was my man, myself, and our 13 month son. We did all you can eat sushi. They charged me $3.00 for my son. Really????? She goes if he's going to eat there is a fee. Ummmm yes he's going to eat do if you are going yo charge us than do it but I'm sooooo confused. When did they start charging for toddlers. But okay!!

My family of 4 live nearby and have tried this place about 4 times. Although the food is good (thanks to the sushi chefs) and reasonable, the service or lack thereof is poor to say it politely. They are simply unfriendly and border on rude at times and they act like they do not care whatsoever whether you come back or not. They do not show any appreciation for our patronage either, which is irritating to say the least when you spend your hard earned money. So much so it makes the whole experience unenjoyable.  It's too bad because we enjoy the food and love sushi and since we live nearby, we want one of those places that we can go to often and you know them and they know and its always a pleasant meal and experience. However, after eating here 4 times and hoping the service will be better each time, it just isn't and we walk out saying well at least the food was good. We really want this to be our place but I guess we'll have to give our hard earned money to another establishment that appreciates it. Very disappointing. If I could give 0 stars I would. Again, this review is not a reflection on the sushi chefs at all, the food is good, its the service and management that has driven us not to return.

This place is clean and the staff is friendly and attentive but if you have a shellfish allergy, don't expect special treatment.  They will not switch out the shrimp tempura for veggie tempura if you order 'all you can eat'.  The good news is that you can order half rolls and try a little of everything.  The 911 roll is no joke.  My bad ass husband was tearing up like a school girl and he does like it hot.  The salmon is nice and fatty and the proportion of salmon and rice is in your favor.  If you sit at the bar, there are little hooks for purses, which is nice.  There is nothing to complain about here.  The sushi is fantastic.

I've been a patron of Sushi Mon for as long as I can remember, and with every visit, I enjoy it more and more.

The place itself is quite small, and features a sushi bar, several tables, and booths. The service here is just lovely; everyone--from the waiters to the sushi chefs--is both kind and courteous. Whenever I enter, I'm always politely greeted by nearly everyone who works there.

The All-You-Can-Eat special at Sushi Mon is probably the best I've seen in the entire Las Vegas valley. For around $25 per person, you can choose as many different types of sushi rolls as you'd like from menus with images of virtually every item available for your convenience. Every roll--cold or baked--is made and served in a timely manner. My personal favorites are the Caterpillar, Lasagna, and Pixie rolls!

The side-dishes offered at Sushi Mon are lovely, as well. They've got anything you might possibly desire, from tuna and octopus poké to cucumber and seaweed salad, miso soup, and baked mussels. One of their newest additions is the sashimi salad, which is simply to die for.

The dessert is, without saying, extraordinary. The green tea ice cream is a must, as are their various flavors of mochi. If you're looking for a quaint little place to have sushi or any other Japanese dishes, this is the place to be!
Orgasm salad not good and way too expensive. All you can eat good. Sushi good especially frying Jason, lasagna and California.

A great sushi place. The fish quality is very good. I only had one bad experience at the restaurant. And it was an employee with a smart mouth. I don't think I can hold it against the place because of a low level employee. So if you are looking for sushi, try it out.
Great food at a great price. The "all you can eat Sushi" for dinner is well worth the money. You need to go when your hungry though. I will definitely be visiting again.
Good sushi...HORRIBLE SMELL INSIDE!  Cant take that gosh awful sewer smell EVERYTIME!    Go there and see what I mean but bring a clothespin.

So fresh! Great sushi chefs with great personalities! This is Goyemon II but without the crispy rice cakes ( for now...they are coming soon).
My boyfriend said to give it a one star because he doesn't want it to get crowded! Lol!
Really great sushi and AYCE too!

The fish wasn't very fresh. It was borderline going bad. I was extremely disappointed. I used to go all the time when I lived on that side of town and it was amazing years ago but I don't think I'll be returning. I've had better sushi from a grocery store.
Thanks to Chef Clyde and Chef Bon for the fresh fish! I absolutely love this place!!!

can't really say I'm a big fan of this place.. to be fair the food is actually very good. they have a great variety of the special rolls on the AYCE menu and ive never had a bad experience as far as taste goes... the servers are the only problem. every time ive eaten here ive usually had a mid 20s male server along with an older woman and they always make me feel rushed. its like im bothering them when I ask for a refill. last time I went we had ordered our last 2 plates along with mochi ice cream at the same time and before the food could even get to use the servers began taking our plates and drinks away... i wasn't even finished eating! i told them i didn't want the last of the food I ordered that they began to bring out and asked for the bill and left. will definitely not go back, it was the last straw service wise. go here if you must for the good quality food, but be warned about these servers.
Went there for a lunch special with my daughter and I very good service  the sushi was good. Can't complain. My daughter is the sushi person and she said it was good so I'll take her word for it.

UPDATE:Returned a few days ago and they definitely made some changes. The sake is very affordable not like other sushi restaurants. Also the food quality is way better. This might be my favorite place. Also the cooks are really nice and constantly check on you. Great food and service. :)
Was recommended here by a valet at our hotel . Amazing hand rolls , the 9-1-1 was intense but worth the heat. Service was great , food was great , can't wait to go again in our next trip

The lunch and dinner selections are excellent, the grilled hamachi Kama was well done with great flavor. Service was prompt and courteous. Have referred friends to this restaurant when traveling to Las Vegas. Will try the all you can eat next visit.

Hubby took me here yesterday night for both of our first times. It's a smaller place, not as big as most sushi places in town. Although it looked as a full house, we were seated within 5-10 minutes. Immediately we were greeted with our server who asked us for our drinks and took a look at the menus.

We both had AYCE sushi, so this is what we ordered.
2x Garlic Tuna Nigiri
Fried Gyoza
Fried Calamari
Shrimp Tempura Roll 
Teriyaki Chicken
Orion Roll (8pcs)
1/2 Order Crispy Rice (5 pcs)
Steamed Shumai
2x Shrimp Tempura
Cajun Albacore Nigiri
1/2 Order Cynthia Roll (5 pcs)
1/2 Order Royal California Roll (5 pcs)

Everything was so good, the service was prompt and all the food came out in good time. Would definitely recommend this place for the sushi lover who doesn't like the craziness of other AYCE sushi places. More secluded, more intimate. Definitely worth it!

We had a great time the staff was friendly the fish was fresh. Everything we ordered came out quickly and we had all around good time this is all you can eat place and my favorite one of them all and I've tried a bunch in the city I just wanted the best so I came hear

***Yelp Challenge 2016 1/100***

Love sushi and especially salmon belly! I always stick with nigri. I like to keep it real! LOL I love mixing things up and getting things like ikura and quail egg. One thing about lunch here is that they don't have uni available. It's ok though. They have many others to choose from. The super white tuna, poke and orgasm salad were all UNO! 

The chef was also super cool. He had a smile the entire time. I recommend this spot to anyone looking to try something different. It's not as packed as the location on eastern. Also don't forget to ask for your stamp car for all you avid sushi eaters! If you don't want it you can give it to me haha JK Happy Sushi Eating. This place will not disappoint.

The rice is big on sushi and they didn't even cook the rice throughly before they make sushi with it, and the most horrible thing they did was charge my son who's 2 years $3 for sharing our ayce.  What kind of business that charges a 2 year old toddler for sharing his parents food.  The menu didn't stated anything about kids charge and the waitress even dare to question why do I get upset after hearing that.  What the hell, I can't even express myself in this damn restaurant and they will charge your toddle for sharing.  I want to give this restaurant 0 star and will never recommend anybody going and I will never come back again!!!

Get the sexy girl. and the dinner combos are great for 2 people.  Would recommend to friends and family.  Service is good and the sushi is fresh.  Enjoyed meals there every time they are consistent with their excellent food.

Went here last night with a group of people. First off you walk in and there is the smell of sewer. Big no no with me. Asked for manager and everybody acts like that's normal for that smell. They have fans blowing when you sit down for a reason. Food is good. We tried pretty much everything on the menu. I agree with other posts on the staff except for one server who stood out from the rest. If she leaves the place is screwed.  They do use a hand held computer for orders which is good.

I decided to try this restaurant instead of my usual sushi place. The food was good and the prices seemed fair from the online menu, but I was not satisfied at all. I called in and ordered it for take out (my boyfriend and I wanted a nice night in for Valentine's Day). When I got there to pick it up, the staff was completely rude and said they had no record of my order so it was never even placed! They said it would be ready in 15 minutes. Fine. After FORTY-FIVE minutes went by, my order was finally "ready", but they forgot one of my rolls, and I had to wait even longer for it to be actually done! Then I got home. I was so disappointed! The rolls are so tiny that it reminded me of how gas station sushi looks - the entire roll could fit in my hand, not exaggerating! The couple extra bucks I would pay at my usual place doesn't seem so bad now. I definitely will not be a customer here again.

I went there 3 times in the past year. First two times were excellent.  The third time not a charm. The sushi rice was cold and mushy.  Cuts of fish were fresh but small. Too much rice for a small piece of fish.  Also very thinly sliced. Teriyaki chicken was precooked with sauce poured over. Pretty dry.  Could be different chef.  Price is reasonable. Will try again because maybe caught a bad day. Servers always good and pleasant.  If your consider price probably 4 stars.

I know this restaurant is owned and managed by the same people as the one on the south side of town, but this one seems just a touch below, and I'm not sure why.  It's still great, and I've been here many times.  Same rolls and food are good here.

Do get:
Futomaki
Spider Roll
Unagi
Super White Tuna
Yellowtail Collar
Green Tea creme brulee
Something with Scallop Yum on it

Great food great service favorite sushi restaurant! Went here with my wife and had a great experience drinks and plates were always Instantly refilled the sushi chef himself was very nice and would talk and laugh with us. Just a great time altogether

I come here quite often because the location is very close to me. It just so happens that they serve very good quality sushi! It has been a few months since I have last visited, but today it seemed like it was exceptionally flavorful. The staff is also fantastic. They're all super sweet and attentive. 
The rolls are always delicious, and well made, especially when they're AYCE which at many places tends to be sloppy. My favorites are their takoyaki, baked green mussels, garlic tuna, super white tuna, red snapper, the Moon Roll, and the Ecstasy Roll.
A couple of small things I wish they could improve on are outside seating and a tiny bit more effort on sweeping. With the outside seating, it gets pretty busy some nights, and you can not sit unless your entire party is present. With the sweeping, the restaurant is pretty much always clean, but my boyfriend dropped a piece from his roll today and there was rice everywhere under his seat. We got the attention of one the staff and told them what happened, and if I was a host or server there, my first instinct would be to sweep it up right away.
My friends and I come here for a day trip from Cali to Vegas from time to time. If that doesn't say good food (for the price) then what does?

The all you can eat is an amazing deal!! We got so much good quality food for a great price! Everything on the menu is included in the deal and it is all high quality.

I lived in Japan for 3 1/2 year, and while the quality here is not quite at that level, it is amazingly great for the states and phenomenal considering its in the desert!

Highly highly recommend!

Sushi Mon's Chef Soto is one of Las Vegas' best-kept secrets!* Go right before lunch ends, around 3PM, sit at the bar, and make a new friend.  I  have him do an omakase-style meal of nigiri and the daily specials (which are all reliably great!), and eat until I can't anymore.
Soto is good at pacing so you can enjoy quite a few pieces of fish before unbuttoning your pants or admitting defeat, and is quite charming to make conversation with as you munch.

Stellar stand-outs: fresh scallop, garlic tuna, cajun albacore, tuna hand roll, ika with mint (totally crazy!), and the sea bass. Sides of mussels, miso, orgasm salad and/or sashimi salad are also good add-ons. 

I'm not too big on rolls here unless I'm ordering to-go, but the Lemon roll, Crispy Spicy Roll, and Moon roll are all good picks- they have quite an extensive menu organized by specials, fried rolls, and tempura rolls and most have pictures to accompany them.

For dessert, I tend to stick to the classic green tea ice cream which is never gritty or chalky, while my BF swears by their tempura ice cream (today's special flavor was chocolate-fudge), but they also have a green tea creme brulee on the dinner menu that I've been meaning to try.

All the staff here are incredibly friendly and genuine, but Chef Soto is my favorite. Even if he's not working, all the guys are willing to feed you the best quality and best tasting fish in town, served with a smile and a joke or two.

EDIT: dropping my rating. Chef Soto and several other familiar faces behind the bar are gone, and with them the top-notch service and quality I've loved about this place.

Now who loves Sushi, I do, I do. Well if you're like me and can be picky at times, Ha Ha Ha.  You will be pleasantly surprised that this small place packs a huge punch with delicious food and great customer services. I went for the early lunch All You Can Eat and I had the Sexy Lady Sushi roll and it was amazing full of flavor and I couldn't get enough of it. The Spider roll was also a top pick and all the other appetizers I tried I really enjoyed. The staff from Chef to wait staff were really good and very attentive to our table. There's no shortage of parking and their restroom was very clean. The grand finale of my lunch was dessert and their Strawberry Monchi ice cream made my day. Be sure to get a stamp/initials to your loyalty card, because after 10 stamps you get a free dinner.

Went in to try this place again tonight after about 5 years and the sewer smell was the same as the reason we stopped going here. They told us it's only been like that a week and they don't know where it's coming from. I told them it was from the sewer system pipes and we left.

Sushi to rice ratio is way off. 2x the rice to thin slice of fish. Don't order appetizers  (miso soup / seaweed salad) they put extra salt to get you to drink more and eat less. They get mad if you don't finish every grain of their rice. "That's a 'no no'. You must eat all rice or they charge you" says the waitress. Who is "they"? Lol 

Quality of cuts is not good as the sushi "chef" leaves the tough "silver skin" in the fish, making it disappetizing. Add the excessive rice clump to the mix and you get expensive gas station quality sushi.

1 star for the can of Febreeze in the bathroom.  Thank you ;)

Tip: You can easily dump their excess sushi by putting all of it into a napkin and flushing it into their toilet! Or load your mouth and spit it into the toilet, if you don't want to keep asking for napkins!)

Health: Kitchen has a moldy stink to it. You may want to give it a wiff while waiting for your table. You may change you dining plans afterwards. I didn't notice it until I went to dump my rice load. 

Go to Kazuki Sushi on Decatur. WAY BETTER AYCE!
Food always good and fresh, get all you can eat, try everything, Salman is the best, I prefer cooked rolls and the cook came up with some special rolls Cartered to my liking

Staff was really friendly as I've always remembered from previous visits when I would be in town. But the quality of the food has unfortunately gone down! 

The chicken yalitori is a thick cut piece of teriyaki on a stick instead of small pieces of juicy chicken. The amount of rice that comes with the nigiri remains small but the quality of the unagi, super white, seared salmon, hamachi, and tamago have declined since my last visit a couple of years ago. Maybe the rolls are still delicious but I only ate nigiri on this visit. 

On the bright side, the tempura is as delicious as I remembered. The yuzu sorbet I could have eaten for the whole hour I was there if I hadn't come with an appetite. 

AYCE- lunch $21.95 / dinner $26.95.

One of the top ayce in town. Service is slow and can take minutes to hours to be seated because of how small the restaurant is. The food itself is great and is always delicious. Average pricing and creative rolls.
Pretty good all you can eat sushi spot in Las Vegas! Sat at the sushi bar and service was definitely quick and we enjoyed our sushi chef Yasu! Would definitely recommend!

This is perhaps the worst service I've experienced from any sushi restaurant. I was out to dinner with 2 friends & after reading the reviews this place relieved, it sounded fantastic. After the first round of orders the quality of the service & sushi went down drastically. The server let us sit for 15min after taking our plates from the first order before returning to take our follow up orders. When the 2nd order had been placed, our server returned 10min later & rudely questioned if we could even finish our order. This led to another 10min wait before receiving our food. I understand having to serve & accommodate other orders/customers, but the delivery of our food was a slow & drawn out process, especially when compared to the super quick food drops when we first sat down. Sushi that was supposed to be hot was cold, & the cold sushi was warm as if it had been sitting out. At this point we knew we were no longer wanted. After flagging down our server, we requested dessert along with the bill. The mochi was on point, but the tempura ice cream was presented in a soggy condition, ending our evening at this establishment. All of this & they had the nerve to ask for a 12% percent gratuity on the check. They treated us horribly as customers. We were not loud in anyway,  rude or disrespectful in any manner, or deserving of this horrendous customer service. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone. Don't waste your time or money.
Perfect quality of food. Perfect service. Fair prices for lunch and dinner. Good location (please come to San Diego). Highly recommend.

One of the best sushi places I've been to. I have been to a few, but this one is definitely one of the favorites. 
I have gone there twice in the past couple of weeks for their all you can eat sushi. Amazing service, and the sushi were just delicious! 
A bit pricey, but totally worth it!

Terrible experience. I drove a long way and arrived 11:25 pm. Closing time is 12:00 am. Not even the smallest attempt to put together a to go order. We litteraly got kicked out. Even though the quality is barely to par, the fact that they are open late made up for that. Not the case anymore. Never going back.
Awesome place.  Went to lunch in March.  Actually went twice.  People nice.  Food fresh and delicious.  Will be back when in Vegas again for sure.

I took my buddy here for his birthday last week. The food was pretty good. I ordered my normal salmon nigiri and a few of their other rolls. Nothing was amazing but it was good for AYCE. Pricing was typical 25-30 per person. The service was good. We enjoyed ourselves.
Excellent. We did the all you can eat with half orders. Fresh and tasty. Because the sushi and service were great.
Great selection, great pricing on the All You Can Eat.  Would go here 5x a week if it wouldn't make me 800 lbs.
Been cmn here for 11 years and it's getting better and better with the years. Love mike the best chef there. The best all you can eat in vegas!

Group of us came here. First time for me and repeat for them. Good idea to order the "all you can eat" for price, speed and selection.
Ordered several items off the menue for all of us and within minutes it was on the table. 
Good food and presentation along with the attention from the server. All around good time here.
Will come back :)
The best Sushi in town we always go there for all you can eat Sushi Lunch $21 Dinner $29/person. Try fried Shrimp head and Calamari.

Never fails when I come here. All you can eat is the way to go. They post their nigiri specials on a blackboard which a lot of sushi joints in vegas don't have. Chefs are nice, friendly and attentive.  Great fish to rice portioning. You can have more than one dessert at the end of your meal. This is my go to AYCE sushi because of the consistent excellent expectations.  So far so gooooood!

whoa. this all you can eat place has me waving the white flag sometimes.

we stroll in here, a few times now, and they never disappoint.

the fish always taste fresh, the fish to rice ratio is perfect. the service is perfect. I really don't have a bad thing to say on this spot after multiple visits.

between this sushi mon and sushi koma, I am a happy camper!

If you don't like the basic rolls then don't come here, variety sucks, fish has a very fishy taste everything is so bland and the green tea ice cream didn't taste the same as it should. Won't be back here

Firstly, this place smells like sewage.  It's not a random event, it's every day.  Don't be deterred and expect to wait.  It's worth it.  This is our regular place.  The staff doesn't change and neither does the quality.  Don't expect fancy over the top rolls to delight your Instagram followers.  Do expect lots of sashimi choices.  Get a punch card, you will be back.  Consistency is where it's at here.  Also, lunch is cheaper with mostly all the same items.  Order the Cajun albacore and the baked mussels... you will be glad you did.  Lastly, if it's your first time, order half rolls so you can try everything.  Happy sushi eating.

After eating here for many years, our favorite sushi chef Hiro-san is gone and now a bunch of inexperienced chefs have taken over. For the first time in 25 years, I spent the night throwing up bad sushi. This used to be a very nice restaurant with the freshest Sushi. Not anymore.

New management, with better quality of foods! Even isn't AYCE, a la carte menu is valuable and it's delicious!
Just missed Happy hour of beer and sake, on Sunday, Monday, Tuesday only, so we will try again!
Excellent sushi and the all you can eat package is truly a bargain. I highly recommend this awesome restaurant. The staff is friendly and service is quick. The sushi is amazing.

Used to come here a few years ago as my go to spot, but the last few times were disappointing. It actually used to be pretty good. Something about their rice makes it too soggy and it falls apart. Had some vegetable tempura that didn't even seem fried all the way and was drenched in grease. I probably won't be coming back to be honest.
Food was old and nasty , poor service don't recommend this sushi place , it's a waist of money

Great spot on the westside for AYCE or take-out.  

All the nigiri is great.  The difference between some lower quality places in town vs the better places is always the quality of the fish.

Best place In Las Vegas to eat sushi. Especially on ayce fresh fish. Friendly staff. The extra side dishes are amazing. The dynamite is the bomb. I will eat that all day every day. Super delicious. Been going here for over 7 years now. Won't go anywhere else

If I could eat sushi everyday for the rest of my life I would. Sushi Mon is a cute lil' sushi restaurant located on Sahara and Cimarron next to Nothing Bundt Cakes. I was being lazy one night and didn't want to dine in, so I got my food to go. Staff was friendly and my order came out quickly. I ordered three rolls:

Sushi Mon Lasagna
Pastel 
Domingo

One thing to note is that the sauces come on the side with to go orders. This is good because it gives me a chance to try the rolls naked. I loved the Domingo roll. It has tuna and avocado with jalapeño salsa on top and ponzu sauce. This roll was super tasty as is, but the addition of ponzu sauce upped the ante for me. I wouldn't hesitate to order this again.

The lasagna was a second favorite. This roll is very decadent. Cream cheese and scallops baked on top of a California roll and smothered in eel sauce. Soooo good and probably a billion calories a piece, but so worth it. I was hesitant the first time I ever tried a lasagna roll. Who knew cream cheese would be so good with fish? Not me. But it is amazing. This is a very rich roll so maybe try half if you have never had it before. 

The pastel was good as well but was my least favorite. It had shrimp and crab wrapped in soy paper, and shrimp and avocado on top. I omitted the cream cheese from this roll but it does come with it. After that lasagna roll I couldn't think about eating more cream cheese. Eel sauce and spicy mayo top this, but I felt like the sauces didn't add much to a pretty plain roll. 

While I sat and waited for my order I was offered water which I declined but thought was nice. Everyone I came across was nice and they even thanked me for waiting. I will be back for the AYCE- Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95.

I've came to this location a few times in the past whenever I come to Vegas. It's fairly off the strip but it's probably the best local spot that doesn't have the Vegas markup. Personally I rather eat this than a Vegas buffet. It's a small humble location in a plaza. The wait staff were super friendly and quick with their service. They do not skimp on anything. I would probably place this in my top 5 sushi spots.

The nigiri is super duper fresh! How do they even get fresh fish all the way out to Vegas!? The price is very typical but you really get your worth in quality. Dessert, drinks all included. I can't really say anything more.
...... still my favorite sushi restaurant ever.   Amazing ayce dinner!   Fresh fish and a lot of varieties ......  so good they already saw me twice this week.

Hait! We're supposed to be in Vegas but end-up in Japan. We are the couple that must find at least one best Japanese restaurant anywhere we go because hubby was an ex-sensei and I'm a forever sashimi-eater. So here we are. We came to Sushi Mon for dinner with hubby's family (the Vegas residence) before, but this time we came for lunch with his nephew. We had a great lunch. They ordered "all you can eat" and I ordered chirashi bowl. So I cannot eat all that I can because "all you can eat" cannot be shared but I was happy with my order. Who needs to eat it all? Most sushi place in Vegas have this type of promotion, all you can eat, surprise that everyone seems to be able to follow this "all you can eat" trend. The servers are Japanese but the four sushi chefs are mixed, could be Japanese and Chinese but I saw one was teaching the other, one was focusing on filleting, one was on a cell phone (kidding!). Of course no one's on a cell phone here, hello! Anyway, the lunch was great and we would come back here, for sure. Someday I'll try that "all you can eat" thing and see whether it's true that I could eat it all! Enjoyed it, thanks! Recommended.

Hm went here with my friends and the sushi was okay. We sat at the sushi bar and the presentation of one of the rolls I got was just awful. Don't get the Domingo roll. It looked like something they scraped off the kitchen floor! But I also got the royal California which was deep fried California rolls for only $6.50! Everything was pretty affordable even though I didn't do AYCE. My friends were really happy and overall we had a great time!
I might come back if my friends want to go again. Nothing really stood out to me, but still a good sushi place.

Definitely my favorite All You Can Eat sushi spot in the area! For lunch, the price is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95. Definitely worth it! The quality of fish is good for all you can eat, the nigiri is nice with little rice so you can eat more . 
The wait can be busy between 6-8pm. Service is quick and on point! Definitely recommend coming by if you're looking for a solid sushi spot and not spend too much money. Enjoy!

This is about the 8th or 9th time I have eaten hear over the last 3 years and I've seen this place fall quite a bit in quality and service. We ordered the all you can eat. We both ordered rolls we had before and were surprised at both how bland they tasted but also on how a couple of them have changed. Their 9-1-1 roll, a past favorite, tasted like nothing but crappy habanero hot sauce. The staff was good and friendly until we were ready to leave. We wondered why they had not come by with the check and when we asked, they told us we had a single piece of sushi left out of the 6 rolls we ate and we were told unless we ate the last bite, they would charge us.  I've seen this policy before on many places but have never seen it implemented in such an unfriendly way. Suffice to say, we will no longer be eating here. 2 of the 6 rolls were good and the rest were meh to bad.

Been to this place a few times with friends. It's good just nothing extraordinary. They offer all-you-can-eat which is a great option for when you're hungry. There really isn't much more to say other than you'll find all of your typical sushi offerings here and it's good enough to satisfy a sushi craving, but don't expect anything exceptional.

They make the best avocado rolls which is the only thing I eat at sushi places
Sushi mon and Kabuki!

Really good place with good services. 
I like this place, I don't think it has the freshest fish but it wasn't the worst fish I've ever had. Lol 
My friends and I went there for Lunch AYCE, it was like $24 including tax. 
We had half orders on a lot of the rolls because that way we can try a little bit of everything. 
I do have to warn you on the 911, we are not kidding. I eat a lot of spicy food but I could barely handle the 911. They straight up use ghost peppers for it because I know what ghost peppers taste like. 
LOVE their nigiri because they don't give you too much rice like other places which is super great. I love it. 
Would definitely come back to this place. 
And I definitely recommend everyone to go there and try the food themselves because it's not bad at all.

This has been my favorite spot for sushi going on a few years now. Just made another visit yesterday and had excellent service for lunch. I recommend the ecstasy roll..it is my favorite!! I also brought a friend with me and it was his first time eating sushi, which he loved!  If you want fresh food, come here!

Update: had a pretty awesome AYCE meal here last weekend. Sat in front of the friendly Kazu-san and had a good time. Incredibly tender unagi. Nice salmon belly and yellowtail belly. Very buttery toro. Sushi rice in the nigiri was on the warm side, and loosely packed - and I appreciated that. All of the nigiri was prepared like this. Kazu-san's got skills!

I was also served a perfectly broiled Yellowtail Collar - medium rare. Delicious. The scallop sushi was very firm and fresh - the closest to live I've had in nigiri form. (Sushi Koma's scallop sushi is rather slimy+fishy in comparison.)

My new hand roll rule: Only order hand rolls one-at-a-time at the sushi bar *only* (to maintain a crispy nori cone). Makes all the difference. Your hand roll nori will become a soggy latex funnel if you let it sit for more than 20 seconds. Gobble it up as soon as it is made!

I am again a big fan of the 'new' Sushi Mon. Great service, little or no wait time, and a convenient location for West-siders. I *do* enjoy the kitchen food at Sushi Koma a little more (e.g. their Tostada, their gyoza) but as far as straight-up sushi goes, Sushi Mon is fantastic.

OMG? talk about all you can eat sushi. 

One of the best thing about Las Vegas. The service and food was great. The chef was very friendly and offered us some really sushi. Definitely one of the best experience in town. He is from Hawaii which made the conversation more comfortable. Although you can only have ama ebi, you can have all your can each ama ebi shrimp heads (which is my favorite). The salmon special was good and huge. Everything else was so delicious, I can't wait to go back.
I haven't been there in quite a while. My friend's and I were pleasantly surprised that the service, quality of the food and price were good. We had a great time.
This is our go to place for sushi for my husband and I. Great service, decently priced menu and best of all, ayce!

Been here many times. Always good service, a smile and great food!
 If you can't be seated right away at a table try the bar. Kinda cool to watch them make the roll in front of you.

Came with my boyfriend around dinner time and it was packed. It's rather a small sushi place compared to others, so we were waiting in line. Once we got in, we chose to sit at the booths which wasn't bad because we got personally served with one of the chefs who was sweet. We did AYCE and ordered several of rolls, seaweed salad and mussles. Food was delicious and service was great, the waiter was always checking up on us. 

Unlimited servings of desserts and the green tea ice cream was delicious! 

Would love to come back here again!
Pretty good all you can eat Mexican sushi.   They restrict the good stuff, but overall a decent meal.

A strong 3 Stars IMHO...

I saw a tip recently that they do a great California Roll here...lol...well they do more than that.  There are only a few incredible things I find here these days (under the "new" owner and staff,) but there is still a lot they are doing right here.

As I see it, there are two reasons to come here: Uni & AYCE.  They don't serve any disappointments here.  Just about everything is a little above average, so with AYCE you get a lot of good food at a solid price $26/$27 I think.  But outside of the Uni there is nothing here worth calling out specifically in my book.  One of the better spots in the immediate area, but not a place I go out of my to get to.

Fresh and lots to choose from. My favorite rolls were the Ecstacy Roll and Sexy Girl. The seared tuna and salmon nigiri was also great. For dessert I would recommend the lychee and green tea ice cream.

I'd give it a zero if I could. My daughter and her 3 friends went there today and all but one had the all you can eat buffet for $23 each. She called me to pick her up because she really felt sick after eating. She had big stomach aches. When we came home she said that the other 2 girls had to throw up and had stomach aches as well. We called the restaurant and the manager said to go to the doctor and have the doctor prove that it was their food which made her sick. Really? And how do I do that? Besides waffles this morning she had nothing else to eat, and the fact that her other friends got sick also should speak for itself. I just found out that one of the others called as well and the manager said she wasn't sorry that they got sick! How absolutely pathetic. We didn't want a free meal, we more wanted the money back, but the manager flat out said no money back. Don't ever go there please and eat the buffet.

The sushi chefs are great.  The food was great but haven't returned since 2014 for one reason even though it was one of my favorite spots to go to.  I will never return just because the waitress/ female server scolded me for having leftovers.  I was extremely stuffed and couldn't take another bite.  She said that "next time, don't leave leftovers. I said, maybe there won't be a next time.  There will never be a next time.

My sister and I have been coming to Sushi Mon for more than a year and we always leave satisfied! The servers are always super nice and coming around to take more sushi orders and refill the drinks. And I love that they offer half rolls so we can try more of the menu and not fill up on was one or two rolls. I love the garlic edamame and the ecstasy roll! I always start and finish with it! Oh and they even have a punch card! We've already gone through two!!

My fiancé and I always come here when we're craving sushi. It's our go to sushi place! 

The service is delightful! The waiters/waitress are very polite and quick. They filled up our glasses as needed, cleaned our dishes as often as possible. (We ordered a lot at a time for a very little table, them taking our dishes away constantly helped a lot!) 

As for the food, 11/10 highly recommend! The baked mussels here are my favorite. We always do AYCE when we come here. The sushi is never dry, it's refreshing. The sushi here is never overloaded by rice like some places. It's the right amount of rice to compliment the fish.

The experience I had here was amazing. This will always be my go to spot for sushi!

What a shame? New ownership. Used to come once a week. Was very friendly relaxed atmosphere. Maybe it's changed in the last 4-5 months, but after the changeover it became very uncomfortable. Large slices of fish became thin. Included items became additional charges. I have a son, 2 years old. As a regular, I think you let people get away with things (I say this as a restaurant owner who let's my regular customers have things all the time). I have to admit, I was annoyed when they charged my son who eats two pieces of a roll and plays with a third piece. I'm not cheap and I don't mind paying for him, but we were good for at least once a week. . . Let it slide. 

Then flavors from the kitchen changed too. Take it or leave it. I bought my restaurant as an existing business as well. Your customers liked what they received. You may think you're improving something, but in reality you are changing something that people like. It was good before. Now we're regulars at sushi koma. Very happy, but miss the old crew.

This place has an all-you-can-eat sushi thing, but the thing is you can't share. It also says there is a time limit, but they don't care, so eat to your limit! I sometimes eat the all-you-can-eat sushi, but I also like the donkatsu which you order separately apart from the all-you-can-eat. As a finale, I always enjoy the strawberry mochi ice cream, my favorite. Don't worry for all you all-you-can-eat peeps, dessert is also all-you-can-eat!

I go to Sushi Mon on Sahara several times per month. The employees are friendly and attentive (unlike their partner Goya Mon on Trop where they make you feel like you are imposing every time you order something). The food is amazing - the sushi is fresh and they offer some favorites like garlic edamame, baked mussels, and  sashimi salad on the all you can eat . I would recommend this sushi place to anyone who is looking to stuff themselves on great food.

Sushi mon was A-OK. We were pressed for time so we just wanted something quick, easy and that would fill us up. 

We tried 3 different rolls: 

Spider roll - (5pcs) Deep fried soft shell crab, crab meat, cucumber and avocado wrapped in soy paper with eel sauce $9.95- The soy paper was green so it looked interesting. The fried crab flavor was faint and almost tasted like shrimp tempura. I wouldn't say it's the best roll I've ever ate, it was basic and not memorable.

Volcano roll - (8pcs) California roll with yum yum sauce & scallop  $8.95 - it was smothered in yum yum mayo/eel sauce. I'm not complaining since I love that decadent stuff. 

Caterpillar roll - (8pcs) Eel and cucumber wrapped with sliced avocado & eel sauce $9.95 - one of the classics! It was good, the eel was fatty and I enjoyed it. But $10 is pretty pricy in my opinion. 

I think that they are overpriced for their presentation and what was offered to us. But businesses have to make their money somehow!

This place has been here as long as I've been living in the area. It is located on Sahara just east of Durango inside a shopping complex. Had no issues parking and came at 1pm just a few hours after opening. 

After the disappointment at 808 tapas I've been craving some good sushi, especially an AYCE spot. In comes Sushi Mon, their AYCE is $21.95 and they give you 45 minutes to eat. 45 minutes may not seem like a lot but at the speed they make them in and how much you can order its more than enough time. 

I ordered some nigiri, salmon, squid, and cajun albacore along with 007 roll, JJ roll, pastel, and alaskan roll. It was all very delicious, service was super fast and very efficient. I was completely stuffed when I walked out and more than satisfied. 

Whats great about this place is if you really want to try something but don't want the 8 pieces, they let you get a half order's with 4 pieces, so you can really try a diverse selection rather than get stuffed on a few items. Remember anything you don't finish they charge you for so make sure your eyes aren't bigger than your stomach.

Get their frequent dining card, after the 10th AYCE you get one free, whats great is if your with someone and they get the AYCE it counts as two on your card so if you go with people that don't go often get credit for their meal. All in all I enjoyed my lunch, at dinner its 3 dollars more for their AYCE and they give you 15 more minutes for a total of 1 hour.

I love the sushi here, they have delicious rolls. The only down side is how busy it can be. Coming here for dinner you have to expect a 30-1 hr wait at least the times I've come. Other than that my favorite place to eat Sushi with a group.

My wife and I eat at this location at least once a month.  Today was our anniversary so we decided to go here.  This visit was awful.  Normally the service is excellent, but tonight not even close.  After our 1st serving of the all you can eat deal the waiter asked if we were ready for desert, and ask three more times before we were finished.  We were reminded that our hour was up and we could make one final order.  I have no problem with this, but it was the first time that has happened.  While I was still chewing my food the waiter who had dropped our check on our table kept checking to see if we put our card out to pay, and we said we would pay at the counter and he said they needed the table.  So before I swallowed we just got up and paid.  I am terribly disappointed and most likely will not go back.  It's sad because the food is great and I can deal with bad service, but not straight up rudeness.
awesome prices awesome food and they are generous with it! i can't forget to mention the great service. this is my new sushi spot! i highly recommend it

Oy. I don't even know where to start. My friends have gone to the Sushi Mon over on Maryland before, and one of them got pretty ill, but she gets sick pretty easily so I didn't necessarily think it was cause to boycott all Sushi Mon locations in the state. How wrong I was. 

I was here the other night on a date (his choice), and I was immediately underwhelmed by the super small interior, fishy smell, and the fact that they said the wait was 20 min but ended up being 35. We finally got seated at the bar and opted for the AYCE, which I normally never do, but seemed like a good idea so I could order some uni and salmon belly. I was slightly skeptical about the quality of the fish, but I've eaten a lot of gross things in my day and figured it couldn't be thaaat bad. 

Well, a few pieces of sushi into the meal, a beetle comes crawling across my plate. That's right, a BEETLE. I sprang into action and crushed that sucker with my napkin, as it became incredibly clear that my date was paralyzed by bugs. Too stunned and disgusted to fully comprehend what just happened, I was in the process of looking around for a server to tell them what I saw when ANOTHER BEETLE came crawling up from under the sushi bar and onto my plate. At this point I jumped up from my seat and my date's face was white, (I was grossed out but also found this whole scenario incredibly funny, and I felt really bad for him), and as small as the place was, no other diners really seemed aware that they were eating next to bugs, and what's more alarming is that the employees barely cared!! A busser came over to take my napkins with the bugs in them that I had already killed, mumbled out an apology, and went on his way. We had to then ask for the bill so we could get out of there, but that was it, no other apology, no comping of anything, we barely ate more than 4 pieces of nigiri and they still charged us for 2 AYCE meals. Absurd. 

Bugs on Sahara, recorded illnesses on Maryland, horrible service at both. Health Inspector...where are you!?

I love this place. The Plum wine is great, the service is awesome. It is a great price point. I can't complain about one thing. I always get the chicken teriyaki bowl, its soo good. Everyone who visits me here, from out of town. I take them there and they love it. We go to the one by South Maryland Parkway.

Me and my family eat here very often. I can say that we've filled out those AYCE cards several times over. I always get the seaweed salad as a starter because of how fresh it tastes, and then basically any bit of sushi, nigiri, and side that they offer on the AYCE menu. I then finish off with one of their desserts such as the mochi ice cream, green tea ice cream, or litchi ice cream. Sometimes they are out of the strawberry mochi (which is my favorite) but I'm fine with getting their other flavors when that happens. While this place is kind of small, it is around the corner from my house so it is the one we always go to. I don't feel like the wait time for food is that bad; if you order several sushi dishes at once they bring the next out just as you finish off the last dish. Go as a group and all get the AYCE so you can share. Lastly, if you order an nigiri, don't forget to request their fresh wasabi to go with it!

Fantastic!

Way away from the strip on Sahara. Seems mostly attended by locals.
Very small, can get hard to get in sometimes.
Fantastic selection of sushi to choose from, all are very fresh and well prepared.
GREAT staff. very friendly
My friend's daughter became sick from the fish there.  When they tried to reach out to sushi mon about it, they ignored their calls and communication attempts.  Stay away from this place.

Never ever make the mistake of going here. I eat tons of sushi and this is the absolute worst ever. Even the server agreed. BUT they have a really good green tea Creme brûlée and chocolate mouse which is more like a ganache. The interior is dirty and non descript. Overall bad. Sorry. I really wanted it to be good as its owned by Monta Ramen which is soooo good.
Great food!!!!! Staff is very friendly.   Fast service!!!  The buffet is worth it!!!!!
The sushi cooks are super friendly and the food is great! Kiran, crispy rice roll, frying Jason and teriyaki chicken are amazing!

This place has pretty crappy quality ACE sushi. The service sucks and slow. The younger japanese waiter is rude and hell when taking your orders (HE WANTS YOU TO NAME THE ORDERS INSTEAD OF USING THE NUMBERS ASSOCIATED WITH THEM). I honestly wish I never tried this place and took the DIRTY CIG BUTT FILLED outside waiting area as a give away this place is trash (SEE PICS)z

Sushi Mon is the sister restaurant to Goyemon, which is one of my favorites, so Sushi Mon is definitely a 5-star in my books as well!

Sushi Mon is on the West side of town, and my family and I love this place. We used to go about once a month to this location when we weren't going to Goyemon across town. We would go for either lunch ($21.95/person) or dinner ($26.95/dinner). Since the menus are essentially the same between the two, I want to call out a lot of the same reasons why we love Sushi Mon. 

Firstly, there are some advantages to going for dinner - 1) they serve salmon belly nigiri, which is way better than getting regular salmon nigiri and 2) you can get 1 order of uni (sea urchin) and 1 order of amaebi (sweet shrimp). Other than these two things, you can pretty much order everything else, including the AYCE dessert, during lunch. The major differences between Sushi Mon and Goyemon is that Goyemon has grilled fish items for dinner, as well as ramen after 11pm, so if you want those items, check out Goyemon instead.

Anyway, our typical order when we go for dinner at Sushi Mon includes the following items: 
1) nigiri - salmon belly, hamachi (yellowtail), saba (mackerel), super white tuna, uni (sea urchin), amaebi (sweet shrimp), snow crab meat, unagi (fresh water eel), and ikura (salmon roe)
2) rolls - Sexy Girl, Hurricane, Sushi Mon Style Lasagna
3) side dishes - steamed gyoza, yakitori, shrimp and vegetable tempura, sashimi salad, miso soup, baked green mussels, udon
4) dessert - lychee sorbet, green ice cream, strawberry mochi, green tea creme brûlée

Just like Goyemon - this is one of the easiest 5-star ratings I can give on Yelp. The only complaint I have about Sushi Mon is that the wait can be long as well, although we've noticed that the wait isn't as long as Goyemon. The restaurant is not all that big, and if you have a group bigger than 4, it can take about an hour to get seated. 

If you ever go to Las Vegas (and you are still reading this review), promise me you'll go to Sushi Mon or its sister restaurant, Goyemon. Ok? Cool, thanks!

This sushi house is awesome! The food is amazing. I have been to a lot of sushi restaurants and by far Sushi Mon is one of my favorite sushi house, their fish is fresh and they make it perfect! Except for the salmon skin, they somehow failed on that one, it tastes burnt and served sloppy. The restaurant is small, wish they would expand the dining a little bigger. Other than that, no real major complaints. Definitely recommended to sushi house goers.
I wrote a review a while back hailing how they had great lunch specials here. Alas, they switched sushi chefs again and the hand rolls have gone from hefty to mini. Sad.
smells weird inside, but the sushi was good. Very quick for togo orders, wish they had delievery though.
This place sucks! Service is the top worst soon as you walk in to when your seated. To top it off the have a sewage fish smell that no one knows where it came from. It s horendous!

The dynamic trio of Tony,Soto and Ben are the best Sushi chefs in Las Vegas!!! Sushi Mon rocks for all your SusHi desires!!! I loved the excellent service and attention to both Detail and special roll requests.. I love this place period!!! The sushi is always fresh and top notch!! Those 3 chefs keep me coming back for their awesome creations!!! Get the all you can eat cause its   Fantastic and made fresh right in front of you

Can't even believe the management here! We had an incident here where the server dropped the tray of ice cold water on my 11 month old son. The tray, the cup, and the water on his head. He was soaked from head to toe and in tears. Now, I know accidents happen but first of all it could have been prevented by not holding a tray over a baby's head. Second, when something like this happens, I would have thought the manager would have come over to make sure my son was ok... Nope all we got was a sorry from the waiter and then he started to clean the water up. So I went back to the restrooms which were both taken at the time, waited there for a minute and just decided to take my son out to the car to change him and calm him down... Once again waiting for the manager to come up to us. So by the time I got to the car I was just livid. All I wanted to do was leave. I knew if I had stayed I would have ripped someone a new one. 

On the way home I called the manager and spoke to him. He was no help what so ever and was claiming that the reason he didn't walk up to us was because "we were in the bathroom"... Which we weren't... And "we walked outside"... Which he still could have came to check on us and make sure my sone was ok. Excuses excuses! One he started to talk over me and would listen to what I was saying, I hung up. 

Needless to say I will never come back and neither will my family and friends.

This is one if the better places in Vegas for AYCE. What I like most is that you can get half orders of most rolls, leaving you free to try out a variety of menu items. Cajun albacore and super white tuna are a must. Additionally, tempura ice cream is on the dessert menu included in AYCE price! Service is excellent, and sushi chefs are very friendly.
Our go-to-place in Vegas when we want comfort food. Food and service is great.  The place is open late for that late night fix.
This place was a good deal! I liked the fact u can do all u can eat with appetizers. It's flavorful & pretty filling  I normally go to Oyshi, but def will come here again due to their fast service
AWESOME FOOD!! Fresh Blue Fin tonight was amazing. Never had a bad experience here. RICHARD IS THE GREATEST!  Great chef who always makes the experience even better!!!
THE BEST QUALITY of Sushi I've ever had in U.S.! Very affordable too. Luch spacials are only $8 and all you can eat for $21. I wish they open one in California. Another reason to come back to Vegas.

The sushi is great, nice and fresh! I do wish the place was bigger because there is always at least a 30 min wait. There is a line that goes out the door sometimes. But the sushi is a good price for the quality!

Service was great. Fooooood was okay tho I honestly couldn't even tell you what I was eating like that salad was not the best but hey I'm like chicken wang type of girl so maybe I just dont understand what I was eating. It's a cute small place but I've had better food other places like this.
Amazing. The chef was so awesome. Helping us try fresh delivered sushimi and the sashimi salad is so Hiro amazing...the best I have EVER had in the world.

1. Go to sushi-mon on maryland
2.  Go to sushi-mon on sahara
3.  Come back and comment

Big difference.  Its disappointing cuz brought mom n dad... told then that sushi-mon is top.  Surprised didn't have to wait at the sahara location now i see why.  

We craved the sea urchin... parents took a bite n told us not to eat them.  Asked waiter if can perhaps ask chef to look and exchange for us.  Without notifying chef nor manager waiter told us urchins come in the same box.  We just let the poor kid slide.  

At sahara, u get way too much rice.  Suggestion:  refill drinks for customers.  Waiter shouldn't  argue with customers; call manager.  Customers are more likely to come back if u treat em right.

Main sushi chef is gone, heard they changed the ownership. That's why they serve sushi worse then ever. Their fish are too dry and most roll came unrolled. Crappy skills. Their customer service got worse as well. The lady at front (maybe new owner or manager?) seemed nice, but she's not even paying attention to the customers. I understand when it's busy I don't complain this much. Our group didn't get refills or orders unless we asked. I miss the good chef and the previous management. Go to Goyemon instead.
The sashimi lunch special is the best in town... They do not scrimp and serve large quality cuts of fresh fish... Check it out and you won't be sorry!

I'm not going to lie, I took an edible before I went here with friends, who were also pretty high, but it didn't hit until about halfway through our all-you-can-eat meal, so I'm about 80% certain that you can still trust my judgement.

The sushi is made fresh to order, and it's all pretty incredible. I tried Uni and raw eel for the first time, and they were both a little different but overall very enjoyable. Their deep-fried rolls were savory and sweet, perfectly crunchy, and somehow still had beautifully raw tuna in the center. The nigiri were simply perfect, where I'm from a lot of the sushi places coat their fish in lemon juice to hide whether or not the fish is fresh, but there was nothing on their fish and it was very good.

I don't generally do desserts when I eat out, but I tried a taste of someone's lychee sorbet and I couldn't help but order some for myself. It was very smooth, and probably the only fruit-flavored frozen dessert that I'd EVER describe as decadent. 

The service is VERY quick and friendly, we didn't have to wait between courses.

Overall I would say that I'd love to go here again!

I'm surprised at the low ratings with this place, because I believe this place is still the best ayce sushi joint in Vegas. Their fish quality is far better than the other ayce places around town, and I love how they have different daily specials. They might not have the fanciest nor most creative looking rolls, but they do their nigiri right. They had Kobe beef nigiri the second to the last time I was there, and it was uhh-maaay-jiiing! I also love their tempura and hamachi kama, which are all included in the ayce. I've heard people say they got charged extra with leftover rice, but if you sit at the sushi bar, you can request the sushi chefs to go easy on the rice. 

Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95 (with the dinner price you can order uni and sweet shrimp with a 1 order limit per person). Service is always attentive and accommodating. I have been a fan of Sushi Mon since day one, and I will continue to keep coming.

Looks like they have a new manager at this location.  We tried to eat dinner here tonight with the family.  It was half full at 7pm and we tried to get a table for 5.  She said it would be 30 minutes.  There were a few empty tables that they could've pushed together.  There was a huge open area in the sushi bar that could've easily accommodated our group.  

I brought this up to the lady...this new manager.  She said that it is their policy NOT to move chairs or tables.   LOL.  Seriously?!!  I asked why is this a policy?!?  She had no explanation but said it was their restaurant policy.  

The sushi chefs...most who we know...just watched and shook their heads.  Probably because we tip the sushi chefs $20 on each visit. 

THANK GOD FOR THIS INCOMPETENT MANAGER.  We left and went to the new Sushi Loca in Downtown Summerlin.  Service, Food, and Price was perfect.  

We will still support sister restaurants Monta and Goyemon, but we will NOT return to this restaurant until this new lady is gone.

Amazing fresh sushi! I'm usually skeptical about where I eat sushi but this place was really clean! They have a lot of sauces also to choose from which I love.. The yum yum sauce is a must try.. It's like a sweet spicy mayo sooooo good. Another cool thing was they had a picture for every roll they serve so you can get a look at it before ordering
Prices are reasonable, considering that it's Japanese food. The food is really good.

All you can eat menu is almost perfect, its affordable and you can order all kind of side dish and desert included to the price.
