I did compare if I were to pay all you can eat vs. a la carte: all you can eat deal is much better with one flow: the rice part of the sushi is too thick but this is almost standard in all sushi restaurants. Staff is friendly, food is fresh and above average. they just need more room at this location. overall, I would recommend it.

Worst service I have EVER experienced at  sushi restaurant.  Got in and it was half full.  We ordered and got some dishes and then everything just stopped.  All the baked items came out so you know that the sushi items were backed up.  Still waited and no one said anything to us.  We had to ask multiple times for them to check on our order and finally they asked us what items we were waiting for.  Once we told them,  the waitress left and then came back 5 minutes later asking us again what we had left! We are now leaving hungry and angry to a place we will never come back to again.  We will be sure to tell everyone to not come here again if they're craving sushi.

I used to go here all the time, started to get a little worse each time. Last I went I asked for a side of spicy mayo with my 3 rolls, they wanted to charge me $1 extra. I understand charging extra for things... but not when I'm purchasing $30 worth of sushi. Also, every time I go in, it doesn't have the most pleasant smell either. Maybe have a plumbing issue? Anyway, they do have a great lunch special and the sushi isn't terrible. I do will go back when I'm in the area, but probably wouldn't go out of my way for it.

My husband and I stop by here whenever we're in Vegas and their sushi is great! I'm not talking about teriyaki chicken or non sushi items. 

Their fish is always fresh and their fish cuts are always bigger than their rice portions.

I highly recommend this place and I usually don't leave reviews. I just felt like there were many people giving poor reviews on non sushi items, but you go to an all you can eat to order sushi, not chicken.
Always great service with a friendly atmosphere. All you can eat Sushi at a great price.

For an AYCE (made to order) I really like this place. They give you a stamp card, and I've been able to redeem 2 this year, that means I got 20 meals (not all myself, i brought guests) so I'm officially hooked. There are a lot of AYCE sushi places to choose from in town now. The new management has taken the food quality up a notch. The high end stuff is back, Toro, Uni, Salmon Belly and Amaebi. The hot dishes are very tasty, tempura is fluffy and crispy, salads are fresh. But do NOT share if you are not paying for All-You-Can-Eat, the make it really uncomfortable for you if you try to slide one by. Mochi for dessert is the best.
No matter how many other sushi place I go to I keep coming back here! Their Sushi, hands down are the Best! Chef Mon is also the best sushi chef ever!!!
Excellent sushi!! I came here for the first time and it was all you an eat sushi. What a deal, and it even included desert. I will come back when I'm in town forsure.

This is the 3rd time we've eaten here and the sushi is always fresh. It's a small restaurant so there can be a wait. It about 15min outside of the strip but it's worth the drive. They serve sweet shrimp sushi and white tuna which are my favorites here. I only order sushi so I don't know about the other dishes. The last time my wife and I came here we waited about 20min which wasn't bad. If you enjoy fresh sushi this is the place to go.

Great first impression! We were greeted at the door by a friendly hostess as the rest of staff greeted us also. 
My husband and I each ordered the all you can eat dinner.  Great selection and variety, even the desserts! Definitely not disappointed!

My in-laws wanted to get all you can eat sushi and this place had the shortest wait time.  We were skeptical at first but compared to the other all you can eat sushi places in Vegas, we really liked it here.   They give you a very small amount of rice without the overpowering seasoning of Yuzu on the sushi.  The choices for appetizers and daily specials are very abundant compared to the other places.  Fish tasted fresh and pretty good for an all you can eat restaurant.  Our server was excellent and always had a smile on his face despite the numerous times we placed our orders.  The only disappointment was their dessert.   But after stuffing yourself with so much food, there is barely any room for dessert anyways.  The more popular all you can eat spots in Vegas will have you waiting for over an hour.  I think this place is less busy but offers better food.  Definitely worth the price!  Free sake when you show Facebook check in!

Not a fan of all you can eat places, particularly when seafood is involved. Often it is an indicator the a la carte is going to be sub par. That being said, seems many of the LV sushi places are all you can eat. Sushi Mon is close by so have tried 2x. It did the trick for a few mediocre rolls of average construction.  Tried the softshell crab tempura which had a funky been sitting in the freezer too long taste.

The service is average as well. Am unsure why this place has gotten such rave reviews. Agree with some other yelpers this place is over-hyped

By far, my favorite sushi restaurant here in Las Vegas!  How they manage to serve quality tasting fish in the middle of the desert is beyond me!  I normally tackle the all-you-can-eat menu, which allows me to try everything in small portions (great when trying new items, or just enough before you call it quits!). The nigiri is great, as well as their house specialty rolls, which I suggest ordering later so you don't cork up your appetite so soon. Don't forget to save room for dessert(s) which is also included in AYCE- the tempura ice cream and lychee sorbet are my favorites!  For smaller appetites, the "screaming orgasm," curry and udon are delicious "regular menu" options.  The staff is always friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is casual and fun. Being such a popular restaurant, you and your party may not be seated right away, but it's definitely worth the wait!
When ever I visit Vegas I try to make it a point to visit this place once before I leave. Great staff. Food comes such with the ayce. Great taste. I will constantly repeat.

I love sushimon! In fact I even had my birthday here ! If you have your birthday there, they give you a free t shirt. And it's really convenient because a nothing bundt is right next door so that's where I got my birthday cake from. I have also been for their lunch sushi special which is only $9. It comes with California roll and sashimi sushi rolls. It also comes with miso soup and salad! I love it here and love coming back!

I'm pretty surprised to see all these mediocre ratings for sushi mon! My experience today was far from those low reviews, if anything I'd say that the quality and service was probably one of the best I've had from any sushi place in a long time!!! My boyfriend and I did AYCE as usual, and at $27 we thought it was pretty pricy, but stayed anyway since it had been a year since we'd last been here. We love to order nigiri, so I'll try to remember everything: 

-tuna
-garlic tuna 
-tako
-salmon 
-blue fin toro 
-euro sea bass 
-poki
-ebi 
-yellowfin 
- 1/2 911 roll
- 1/2 a chi chi 
- 1/2 sexy girl 
- 1/2 crispy rice 

I can't go into detail describing every dish since it's all pretty self explanatory and the last 4 specialty rolls I forget what was in them :(  I will tell you this though, the quality of the fish was superb, especially the salmon belly and toro (it melted in your mouth!) but the best part was the quantity of fish!!! Some places they give you a huge chunk of rice with a thin later of fish... Not here, not this time! Thick ass pieces!! Excuse my language, I'm just that excited!!! And our chef, BEN, was super nice, explained every kind of fish, their delivery dates, and even made us some nice nigiri pieces that were not on the menu. This totally made the price well worth it, and the staff weren't awkward when we ordered half their inventory, like we usually do when we order sushi.  We also arrived right after the lunch menu, 4pm, so it was not crowded and noisy, and had all their attention!! 

Great place, friendly staff, superb service, and superior quality and quantity of fish. Shout out to Ben once again for the service!!! 
Thank god I wore my stretchy pants today!!!

I visited this sushi restaurant with a friend for lunch. I got the sashimi combo which came with a side salad and miso soup. The sashimi was tuna, yellowtail, some white fish and salmon. The side salad was actually quite disgusting. I had one bite and was done. My sashimi was overall okay. The white fish had an unusual texture that threw me off. I eat sushi quite often & will pretty much try anything but this was just not good. The prices are very reasonable. I would probably not return.

This Sushi-Mon is in my hood and recently was purchased by the Mon group, should be AWESOME right since Goyemon is the businesssssss. A decrease in the hour wait time, some delicious grilled pork belly, and various other delicious appetizers.

To echo Jen S. this is a goyemon-lite. They have some of the same appetizers, some of the same specials, and some of the same desserts. They also probably have the same quality fish assuming its the same supplier, but its definitely not the same here. The fish cuts are weird, the assembly of the sushi is different, and the rice is cool. When I say cool I don't mean cool like the button you're gonna hit after reading my review, but cool temperature. Perhaps they don't have the same rice warmer as Goyemon, but to eat cold uni and cold rice, blehhhhh.

Better than some AYCE places, but I will be continue my travels to Goyemon land.

Called and asked if they were still open at 10pm... they said last seating was at 11pm so told them we will be there asap... got there at 1040pm and walked in... they all gave us the death stare and told us they already finished last call... lol... i work in this industry, how are you going to lie and say such shit when even the posted sign says last seating is ar 11pm and last call is after that? Lame.

Me and my husband come here once a week. The food is nice, especially the fish is fresh, and the staff are very friendly and kind. You don't have to wait really long time for your food to come out comparing to other AYCE place that we've went. The staff always work with smiley face! You should try this place.
Best sushi in Las Vegas. Sushi chefs are great. Hiroshima is so nice. And fish is fresh.

I liked here sushi quality.
Perfect amount of rice.
Chefs were very friendly.
Clean and good atmsphere.

went here for sushi, yesterday. the food was pretty okay. but what really got me was how my friend and i were treated by our waitress. she forgot our water and we waited 15 minutes waiting for water until we had to call another waitress to get our drinks. then they also forgot our dessert, so we had to remind them again. i dont plan on going here again.

We're here usually once a month, never had any complaints, the service is prompt and excellent, not what you usually get with AYCE places. Food quality is always great, excellent value for money, creative rolls as well as tried and trusted standard. Always some fun specials you should be sure to check out on the boards. Parking is easy, great location, in particular if you're living on the west side.

NEVER GO TO THIS PLACE! Theres lots of sushi places in town to choose from, not worth being treated bad. I had a party of 13 with me and we were all present and there is a sign on the door that says 80% of your party must be present before being seated. There was a section for us to be seated but there was a party of 2 waiting on 3 more, that was hindering us to sit as a family. I asked them to have those 2 to get up and wait but they refused, I asked for a manager but no manager present. Now we were forced to sit at the bar, now I couldn't talk to my cousins on the otherside. It was supposed to be a wonderful family outing which turned horrible as we couldn't catch up with each other and couldn't communicate. At The end of the dinner, they were 3 extra rolls because we all couldn't communicate of who is ordering what and our servers couldn't tell us what was coming. So the server decided to charge us for the extra rolls. I asked them that why you made an exception for them breaking the rules but not us? I've been coming to this place for years and I'm always bringing 10-16 party with me. If not a large party, it's just my family of 3 or 4 and we eat there 2-3 times a month. I'm always in good hands with Ulyiss as be is always making sure our drinks are full and empty plates gets removed. But with this experience, never again and now I'm aware of all these social media review, I'm making sure non of my friends or family gets treated that way. I even had the server agree that I had all my party preset but sat a different party that WAS NOT 80% present.

Lots of good reviews on here so I went. Also kudos from co-workers. I am on the fence. Not very fresh, fish was warm and so was some of the rice. Sushi rollers ( would not call them chefs) not that friendly. Wait staff was okay. Tasted something funky in the Alaskan roll. Good thing they give you half rolls! I don't think I would try this one again.

Went for the lunch specials with a friend. This restaurant has been consistently good   I had the sashimi plate that came with 9 pieces of fish, miso soup and a salad. My friend ordered 2 specialty rolls that also came with soup and a salad. Oh and slices oranges at the end. Perfect meal

Awesome All You Can Eat Sushi!!
Traveled from Hawai'i and came to Sushi Mon for the first time with family. Decent price ($27) per person, all-you-can-eat dinner and dessert.
Although we came while it was busy, the wait to sit wasn't too bad.
The service was great, the waiters/waitresses we very attentive. The food was excellent- hands down ;)

Was here last night. One of, if not my favorite sushi place in town. Friendly staff who helps you if you don't what what fish is what. With a great selection of rolls, including the Spider and the Dragon. The sake wasn't my favorite, but overall a great place.

Been coming here for years. Sometimes the sewer smell inside is really bad. I have not been there in a while so maybe they fixed the issue they had. I would almost do take out all the time. It's not the best sushi but not the worst. 

I usually get the lunch specials if I'm working near by.

So yummy! Had a dinner date with my girls and we so amazing. You definitely need to get there early they are really busy around dinner time! The conch was delish! Ayce is a must then you can try a bit of everything! They also do half rolls which makes it easier to taste everything. The strawberry saki was very good as well! Will definitely be coming here again!!

Since last been there 3 years ago, the management has changed and the food was no longer as good. The establishment had been expanded and added a sushi island and the all your can eat price is cut in half. However, if the food quality and selection went down by half, I don't know why I would take that extra time to go away from the Strip just to visit this place.

This had been my all time favorite in the past and this time, it let me down big time. I will no longer be visiting this restaurant. I miss the meal I had in 2011.

My husband and I have been coming here for years.. Really loved this place for all you can eat sushi. It only takes one bad experience to run off good customers!! They have a sign as soon as you walk in that if all your party is not present, that seat will be given to next customers.. So was not the case today.. As they left 2 open seats empty for 15 minutes to wait for another person to join a party at sushi bar as other people were waiting for seats. When I asked employee for a manager, she paused for a few seconds and said that they were not available!! One star because I really liked the variety; but we ended finding something better and less expensive without all the "rules" and "time limit"!!

I've come here twice, once with my s/o and the other with my cousin. When I sat Bar side the orders were made very promptly! The fish was absolutely terrific and it none of the items seem overloaded with rice. Staff is polite and quick to check on us, the sushi chefs are great jokesters! Tricked my cousin into eating a piece of the 911 with me, the chefs gave him some cream cheese on the house to cool his mouth...and jokingly asked if he'd like the habanero sauce with it  

I would urge to order the uni, however when I dined with my s/o i believe I came across a bad batch. We ate the exact same items, save for the uni and I ended up becoming ill and blowing chunks once we arrived home 

Other than that experience I love the place and would come again for sure! I wouldn't blame the staff over that incident.

It was my birthday and I wanted Sushi. I had come here once years ago and didnt really remember the experiance but I figured if I didnt remember anything bad, then I must have enjoyed myself. I was not disappointed. Let me say that every selecion I made was delicious. The staff answered any question my wife or I had. The food came quick and the staff was attentive to our needs. Now for the best part. Due to the fact that it was my birthday (I let the waitress know) when my icecream dessert was served, it had a candle on it and a chorus of happy birthday began. If that wasnt enough as we were about to leave my waitress asked what size I wore, and she presented me with a shirt for my birthday! What a way to finish the evening. I shall return.

Deeeelicious sushiiiii!!! Of course get the all you can eat and order half rolls of everything...the sushi chefs will make you amaziiing rolls. Super friendly staff. Fast service. I'll have to go back so i can recommend the ones i loved :)

Considering this is location is now a member of the Mon Restaurant Group, I guess it would be easiest to compare this place to Goyemon.

Not as many choices as Goyemon. Appetizer items such as kama, gyoza, yakitori, and even takoyaki. But you won't find any udon or ramen, grilled pork, spicy tuna on rice crackers, etc. There is a blackboard with daily special however.

The quality of the fish is similar to Goyemon or any other AYCE sushi restaurant, not Sushi Dai, but definitely not shark chum. The service was above average, but sometimes the chefs were a little distracted with the tv or chatting with each other.

I guess you can describe this Sushi Mon as "Goyemon-lite" or a little brother to Goyemon. It is a solid AYCE sushi addition to the west side of the valley for anyone who doesn't want to drive all the way to Sushi Mon's "older brother."

Summary: Disappointed

Cons:

-Probably the worst fish to rice ratio at an ayce sushi place I have been too. I have been to almost all of the ayce sushi place in orange county and only a handful of ayce sushi places in LA, but I have never seen a worse rice to rise ratio for both the nigri pieces and the rolls. Actually some of the rolls were ridiculous large, especially the 5 piece rolls. The biggest rolls I have ever seen. When the menu states that you will be charge for extra rice, and then the rolls comes out a gigantic and filled with rice. Should have taken a picture of this. 

-Service. Our server was new, but overall very nice and did the best he can. We asked him if we can get a spider hand roll and he wasn't sure. My biggest gripe is that we have a kid. Most AYCE places have a different price for kids. He failed to mention this. A kid that is 8 years old should not be charge the same price as an adult, if everybody is charged the same price the restaurant should let customers know. 

-From the rice to fish ratio, to not disclosing the price difference, can't help but feel a bit of disingenuous on part of the owner. At the very least it is a lack of disclosing information that could easily enhanced a customer's experience. 

Pros: The freshness and quality of the fish is above average in comparison to most of the ayce places I have been to. Too bad you only get to get a thin slice/small piece of it. If it wasn't for the quality of the fish, this place would really get one star.

I come here all the time. It's my go to place, very affordable and very clean. The bathrooms are awesome as well. Food there is Grade A and some of the best sushi I've ever had. The chefs there are so nice and friendly, there's an older Japanese man who is just the cutest! And he always makes my rolls perfect. 10/10 always. The staff is also very friendly and helpful with every question I have.

Came as soon as it opened and it was already busy. Visiting from Hawaii so this was our very first time. Service was great. It took a while to get our orders but we weren't in a rush so we didn't mind. Great quality food!!!  We did the all You can eat for lunch which is 21.95 dinner is $26.95. So we made sure we Ate it's worth. Will return next time in Vegas.

One of my new favorite sushi places in Vegas!! The food was amazing and the staff was very friendly! I opt for the all you can eat and what a great lunch price! Only $$21 before 4pm! I will be returning for sure!

i don't want them points.
because, they changed owner so now they are changed staff and owner.
i go this restaurant for 5-6years. 
and today i had so so dinner all you can eat. 
after all you can eat i just asking to manager, what's your name? because of my college project i need your name, and he was scowl his face say to me NO. and waving his hand. what make him upset? did i do something wrong?
in my opinion  manager should have their name tag on their shirt don't they?
and also manager is their restaurants face. what's wrong? don't go their you can feel with horrible service.

It might be our 10th time here and it's the first time in my life that I don't have to speak to order the chef Sung already know exactly what I am looking for me and my girlfriend. Very good quality awesome ambiance, great service and best food. Well done !!!

This used to be our main All-you-can-eat sushi place where we'd go twice a week. It all changed when they got new owners. It's okay, but not the same service -- probably because our regular sushi chefs went to Goyemon. 

They have the same menu as before but the quality is different. I know you're thinking, how I can tell, but if you've gone to the same place for years and the fish doesn't taste the same, then I have to say the quality is different. 

On the other hand, compared to many of the other sushi restaurants, I think it passes for OK. The new service is friendly.  If you're nearby and you needed AYCE sushi place, try it. It might not be the best, but probably a good value.

Not a fan of this place my husband and I have raved about this place for years it's been awhile since we've been in so I decided to have lunch there with my mom I ordered three rolls of California rolls when I got them I could barely taste the crab and the roles were very small the Cucumber normally has the peel outer skin shaved off but they kept it on making it very hard to chew when the rest of the scroll is soft it jabbed me in top of the mouth every time the avocado was so thin I didn't even taste it definitely would not recommend this place to anyone and do not plan on returning back I also ordered vegetable tempura it was definitely supersaturated and oil and cooked very quickly as opposed to them being dried and the tempura overall looking a lot better I just peeled off the outer breading and eat the vegetables no big the cucumber salad that we ordered once again was 50% skin and 50% cucumber not yummy will you have to chew the crap out of your cucumber salad I ordered two drinks two dr. Peppers they were a buck seventy-five apiece not bad I was done eating my three orders of sushi - 3 small bites and I asked the lady for a to-go cup she told me I'm sorry we don't have to go cups I don't understand how I can pay for a drink and not take it that's not right I paid for all of my stuff alicart and it was not all you can eat there should be no reason why they shouldn't offer to go cup I don't think that is good service at all so I sat there and extra 30 minutes while I drink my drink and that time I stared at the check and realize they forgot to charge me for the drinks mind you I was upset that they didn't have a to-go cup I thought that was rude but I wanted to make sure that they didn't offer the drinks because if that was the case I had no right to complain about not having a to-go cup the lady said to me oh no she forgot to charge you so me being the nice person I am cuz I could have said that's your problem not mine I had her fix the bill to charge me for two drinks but seriously there was maybe four people in that shop and you forget to add the bill correctly I definitely will not be back and I will make sure the people know my opinion when it comes to Sushi Mon I will definitely be returning to Sushi 21 on Flamingo and Decatur it is worth the drive because apparently nothing close to me is halfway decent

We decided to come here after learning it was part of the "mon" chains and we love goyemon! It's a smaller establishment and I used to come here a bunch when it was owned by an previous owner. We were seated right away and they told me that it would be $3 bucks for my one year old to eat. That irked be a little bit, because 1. how much can a one year old really eat and 2. I was feeding my child food that I had brought at that exact moment when they asked. 

Overall, the sushi quality was decent. Like other Yelpers have said the selection isn't as large as Goyemon, but the main thing was that the sushi quality was good and I actually did enjoy it. Halfway through the meal it realized one of the sushi chefs was a chef I knew from before.  Chef Tony is awesome! If I ever get a chance to sit at the bar I would want him to make my sushi. 

Service was a bit slow, but the sushi came out fairly quick.  It just takes awhile to get their attention to order more when you are at a table. I will be back for some more sushi one of these days!

Clyde is the best Chef! He makes my favorite sauce for dipping my fish! He spoils me with fresh fish I only eat sashimi, I don't do rolls that much! I walk in and don't even look at the menu, I sit down order a nice cold Kirrin draft beer. Clyde starts bringing out all the fresh fish of the day!  One of my favorite fish is the Salmon Belly!! Yummy 

Love love this place! Try the Creme Brulee for dessert, sometimes they make green tea Creme Brulee its different! 

Great service, great food, great prices! Clean & healthy food! Win win situation! Hope you enjoy it as much as I do!

Just got my daughter home from the ER.  She has been a regular customer of this particular Sushi Mon for some time, and went in this afternoon for lunch, ordering Salmon Rolls.  Unfortunately, this time...she ended up with Scombroid food poisoning (which if you don't feel like looking it up - is specifically caused by ingesting DECAYED fish.  Lovely.

When she (and her husband) attempted to call to speak with a manger to inform them, they're response was to HANG UP ON THEM?  Probably not they're smartest move.  Already submited a complaint to Clark County Health District.  

I'm not a sushi eater myself, and can only hope this was an isolated incident, but it's extremely disappointing that any establishment would hang up on a customer, especially when it could end up backfiring on them!

Well, I've been to a ton of sushi places, but a few reasons why me and my gf seem to always come back to this place. Sushi Chef Soto, or as we call it now, the Soto experience. Come and sit at the counter and have him make you all the great specials share some great knowledge about sushi. 
Everything is so fresh and there is a great variety of rolls to choose from.  Scallop with yuzu is my personal favorite nagiri. Don't leave without trying the orgasm salad and don't forget about that Mochi Ice Cream. 
Get the all you can eat and enjoy.

sushi Mon is our go to Sushi place. Food is consistent, always fresh and yummy. chef's are passionate with what they create- sushi rolls are eye catching and dekectable. the bus boy Ulysees is forever sweet, friendly and customer service is exemplary. the waitress are all pleasant and friendly. location is accessible with ample parking. cleanliness is consistent! this is one place to add to your favorites!

This place is back on my list, they must have gotten new management or something. But their fish quality is really good and I like how their rice portion to sushi is smaller than other AYCE sushi spots. Although they don't have torro I can settle of them and they also do half rolls not like other AYCE sushi spots where your last roll is a half. They also have a stamp card :)

Customer service is great. The sushi is good, not my favorite, but they do have takoyaki; so that's a plus. They have some pretty interesting and yummy rolls. The O.I.D is slightly sweet a savory, the chubby roll is very very crisp and super refreshing. The 911 has spicy tuna and habanero sauce so it is extremely spicy almost too much to be enjoyable. But overall with the decent food and great service it's a must try at least once
I gave my opinion when i checked in. Not the greatest sushi place. I just ate here coz it's close to my house.  Should have had pizza instead

I love this place! I always get ayce because as much as I eat it's worth it. They have a good variety of appetizers that come with the ayce I always get baked mussels and garlic edamame. My favorite nigiri is garlic tuna and Cajun albacore. The Cynthia roll and spider roll are delicious!!! This is my to go spot and even when it's busy we still get great service.

This review probably more to do with what Sushi Mon used to be and less about what it is now. Since new management took over, there no longer is Uni (which I actually don't like but feel like it added some value to the AYCE), Toro, Sake Shooters or unlimited sake Mon-Thu. I am not sure if it has actually gone up in price but it feels like it has and the value isn't as good as it used to be. 

The fish here is still pretty solid, there is a crispy rice and tuna roll that is probably the best thing we had there. Also the chefs don't seem to be as heavy handed with the yuzu which was one of my main complaints in the past. The one thing I didn't like was the Ahi Poke bowl. It used to be a nice starter of just fresh pieces, now it has a lot of other things in the bowl which I did not appreciate. Still a place that is probably worth the AYCE price, and the food is good but it used to be better so I think I am comparing it to that

Love love love love this place! I used to eat here a couple times a week until I was kinda spent on it. Needed a break. =)

Their waitstaff are super friendly and bust their asses to keep you happy. They always remember me when I walk in too, which makes a huge difference to me. Restaurant is always clean as well, including the bathrooms.

Everything here is delicious. I've never had one thing here that wasn't, and I've tried pretty much everything on the menu. However, they changed their menu pretty recently and got rid of a lot of the dinner specials. This makes me sad. Their "love boat" dinner special was the best! They still have a lot of dinner specials though, like the salmon special, which is so good and such a great value.

I don't think they have their volcano #2 roll either, which was amazing!

I've never done the all you can eat sushi here, so I can't vouch for that.
Sushi Mon for me is hit or miss. There have been times when I've had excellent sushi and other times not so good. Staff is very friendly and welcoming which is why I keep going.

I have been coming here for a ling time and I don't really write reviews but I have to say this is one of my top sushi places to go to, hands down!! I have not had any major let downs from this place from past visits. I did go to Sushi Mon last night and a few nights before and both visit were pleasant. :)


Restaurant
A bit small but it is worth the wait if you go with a group. Price is a bit more than most places but worth every single penny. :) Family oriented and clean kind of. The restrooms did have a smell but what would you expect, people do their business in there. Lol 

Service
Is on point, my server was very friendly and suggested a few other food items that weren't listed on the menu. She also tended to my table before the food was done/finished so waiting for the next orders wouldn't take long to wait. 

Food
Nigiri was awesome. Came out quick and the salmon belly is mouth watering. You just have to ask since they do run out quickly. Lol The baked mussels are fresh unlike a few other places where they get precooked mussels. :(
Pork belly is good but not the best that I have tried at a sushi restaurant. They also do half orders on most of their rolls, so if your not to sure if you can finish just get half order or hand rolls.

Cons
They don't  serve fresh oysters and the
steamed gyoza was burt at the bottom of them :(


All in all 4.5 stars :) good job Sushi Mon.

Very good sushi!. Went there two days i a row for lunch. The second day I went for lunch I asked for dinner price to eat Uni. It was worth every penny to pay 5 dollars more. 

The service was great. Easy to call service all the time. Also recommend sitting at sushi bar. It is easier to order when you sit in front of the chef.  The sushi chef remembered me from yesterday and started to make sushi for me after asking me if I want similar sushi/ portions from yesterday. The dessert green tea ice cream was kind of lacking, but the tempura ice cream was very good. 

Overall I would recommend anyone to eat here. I would personally come here regularly if I lived around the area.
Amazing AYCE sushi!!! Great flavor and great service. The sewer smell is very off putting, but after awhile you don't notice it. The sushi makes up for the weird smell.

We used to go here all the time when my sis lived here. I think it was way beforeYelp days. We came into town & my sis happened to remind me of Sushi Mon so we came back after maybe 10 years to see if it was still good ... And it was! We did the all-you-can-eat dinner. I ate a ton of hamachi nigiri without worrying about the bill being racked up. The salmon was a little tough though. the new thing was a time limit and signs saying you'll be charged if you don't eat everything but I think that was mainly for people who just eat the sashimi & leave piles of uneaten rice. I understand they don't want waste now to lose money so it didn't bother me too much. Service was great - not too often and not pushy on drinks or upsales. Good food & service for the right sushi price. We'll be back again!

My father and I cane here for dinner. The restaurant is clean. The chefs and waiters are friendly. The fish is clean. They serve accordingly. Major key (the fish taste very clean). The ambiance is happy and fun. I finished with a delicious green tea mochi.

Wonderful selection of sashimi and specialties creations as part of the all you can eat menu.
Well thought out all you can eat menu with the consumers value in mind. 
They offer what most places in town try and either upscale or don't even offer. 
Very fast to the table even when it's busy

I'm not a fan of all you can eat Asian food, because I know the quality isn't there.  I'd much prefer quality over quantity when talking about food.  I must say though sushi mon is legit.  They make all the sushi fresh to order.  You just tell the waitress or sushi chef what you want and they make it right there.  The variety of different sashimi / sushi rolls / appetizers makes this place well worth the $26.95 for dinner.  

There are some sashimi's that you can only order just one per person because of how expensive it is, but at least you get to try it still.  

The people working there were really nice.  It wasn't too busy, but I herd when it gets busy that the food takes awhile to come out.  You have to make sure that you eat all your food along with the rice or else you'll get charged extra.  

I'll definitely come back to this place when I come back to Vegas!
I went here with a few friends a few nights ago. The food was amazing, great customer service! I would highly recommend this place!

This was my favorite AYCE sushi spot at one time. That was before the new owner started changing everything in here. The changes that really hurt this place is the staff and the menu.

There have been more changes since I was last there. Now there is a new sushi counter. I liked the previous counter better than the new one. The motor for the refrigeration unit seems to give off a lot of heat towards the end of the counter. Not to mention the counter was filthy where I sat down. Not only was the counter top filthy, but there was a bug in my daughters volcano roll. I handed the dish back to the guy behind the sushi bar and he set the plate down on the counter where they were preparing sushi.

I would also like to know why there are no Asian people working there anymore? This is an Asian restaurant, is it not? The other owner had Japanese sushi chefs. Now the new owner just hires anyone to roll up fish and rice. I'm not saying you have to be Japanese to make sushi, but come on man. Where is the authentic vibe that used to be here? It's just like a fast food place now. All they need is a drive through window.

Well, I can say after seven years of frequenting this establishment, I won't be back. I'm not feeling the new Sushi Mon. It use to be my favorite place. What a shame.

It took me a while thinking about write this review.
I'm crazy with sushi-mon. My husband always call me a sushi monster !!

I usually go to sushi mon around 2-3 times a month for at least 2 years. When I heard they changed the owner I wasn't care but somehow the feeling of enjoyment has changed too!
The food is 4 stars for me.

The new upgraded design was nice but the service is getting worst every time I go there. 

I've always enjoying the service and conversation with couple Thai ladies and Yuki ( I think that was her name ) They are seem very polite, give us attentions and make the place feel welcome, But lately I haven't seen them much ( maybe my schedule have changed ) I went there on Thursday night (3/13/14) it was 3 groups of people only and I still received a shitty service from them!
 
The waitress were so MEAN!! For some reason which is I do not understand at all. We are a customer who going to give you tips and pay for what we eat!  We are not begging you for a free food!!! There were No smile No Hello No goodbye  No thank you!!! Just a simple unhappy face like this :( 
When I ordered she do not give me and signal that she got it just walk away. When she brought the food she just drop it next to me not even in front of me then walk away. 
We have to waved to get their attention. It was horrible. 

We are hoping that the service somehow get better. Maybe I'll go back maybe I won't.

Worst experience today! We always come here (almost every week to be exact). Often we get the nice lady servers or the Japanese servers who were always so nice and funny! Unfortunately today we had this server who's fairly new compared to the others named Zac---- I don't want to spell his name out. But, the last time as well around November or so, I remember he only got 40% of our orders right which had led us to stop coming here. But then we gave this place a chance and came back from January until today. We were celebrating a birthday and my aunt, who doesn't know how to use the chopsticks very well, dropped two small pieces of rice on the bare table as she was grabbing sushi from the middle of the table. So tiny that literally if I can count the grains approximately 10 grains. So this server named Zac---- came in sarcastically implying that he was gonna charge us for those, pointing at those small pieces and rolling his eyes at the same time. My aunt felt so bad that she said she was just gonna eat it but he said oh sure don't worry about it. So what was he really implying? Never coming here again and just so you have an idea how many times we go here, we've used 5 of the stamp cards already! Note: if you're coming here and you want great service, avoid the one person with the Zac---- first letters! All the other ladies are so nice! But just avoid this one server! Ugh definitely ruined our dinner. What a guy!

Last night, my boyfriend & I decided to take my sister & her girlfriend out on a DOUBLE DATE here! We did AYCE (60min timer for dinner!)

The sushi rolls we ordered were:

Alaskan - simple, yet tasty.
007 - we all liked this one a lot! Fresh, clean taste!
Orion - Fantastic!
911 - NO JOKE! So spicy. 
Stacey
Lemon - interesting taste.
J.J
Mahalo - Spam-tastic!
Tiger - my favorite! Fans of shrimp tempura!
Cynthia 
Royal California - if you like CA rolls, this is a must try.
Spider - we ordered plenty of this! Delish.

The side dishes we ordered were:

Edamame - YES!
Steamed AND Fried Gyoza - Eh.
Steamed Shumai - Eh.
Fried Calamari - So good! We killed three orders.
Vegetable Tempura - I wish they had broccoli tempura... 
Shrimp Tempura - A MUST HAVE!
Octupus Poki - First time trying this... not too fond of it.
Seaweed Salad - A MUST HAVE! So good.

For dessert, we had:

Green tea mochi - I didn't like the texture of the gooey shell around the ice cream. 
Green tea creme brûlée
chocolate mousse

The service was awesome! The Filipino server was very attentive and friendly. 

Our bill came out to be 127$ for 4 AYCEs (@27/person) and a small and large Sapporo.

bombdotcom lol
For real, pretty damn good AYCE sushi. tried a bunch of different rolls, all of which had amazing flavor. We went pretty late, so we were some of the only people there and service was fast. 
The "rules" posted on the little menus were kind of ridiculous, though. and the sewage smell was disgusting. 
That smell wasn't around the last time I was here, though, so I wonder if the plaza is having plumbing issues? Either way, fix that, cause it's overpowering and smells like straight SH*T.

Very trendy.  They cater to a younger crowd.  The service and the atmosphere is young and now!   I got the impression that middle aged singles are not welcome.
The food is good. I had the tempura it was delicious.

Sushi Mon (Goeymon, Monta Ramen, etc.) and the other restaurants owned by this company used to be our favorite place to go. We've been here almost hundred times in the past few years. The food is definitely fantastic and the price is right. HOWEVER, my boyfriend got insane flu after we ate at Sushi Mon on W. Sahara on 12/26/16. One of the sushi chefs named Mike was sick and he kept wiping his runny nose while making sushi for us. He didn't wear any gloves either. Needles to say, my BF got sick with very bad cold/flu shortly after and couldn't get over it for 3 weeks. I didn't catch it because I already had had the same virus back in the fall. Now we don't know where to go for quality sushi but we definitely won't be eating at any of - Mon chain restaurants ever again. What a shame!
I love this place for lunch when I'm in a bit of a hurry. I've tried other places around town and always come back here. The sashimi lunch is so fresh and delicious and reasonably priced.

This place has changed so it deserves a new review.

First off, they eliminated fountain drinks in favor of $1.99 (or so) per CAN of soda/iced tea/etc. This move was clearly about the money cause you can get pretty thirsty with all that rice they add onto the sushi (yes, a nice amount of rice with a slightly less proportioned slice of fish). 

Then, they replaced my Sushi Mon card with a location limited Sushi Mon card without my permission (meaning if I had most of my stamps from the other Sushi Mon location, say for example, because I live closest there and I frequent that location the most, I can no longer go to that location with my stamp card I'm forced to go to the Sahara location as it says it's limited to that location only). 

I've been coming here for over 10 years (that's right), and sadly, I've watched it decline from what it once was when i would first go there. My friend and I were waiting 10 minutes till we received our 5 orders of salmon, while the table who was seated 10 minutes after we were seated got their order of 2 rolls within 10 minutes of being seated. This continued until I complained to the waiter, pointing out how full their table had gotten with food ordered from the sushi bar, in comparison to us who have only been served a small amount of items within a larger span of time. It made me pretty unhappy but after I pointed it out we magically began getting 3-4 other orders to our table within 15 mins , much like the table beside us. 

The one thing that their menu has that no other AYCE restaurant has is halibut. The quality of the fish is good, the service is lacking... still. 

It's also extremely annoying when you're at the bar and constantly having to remind the chefs what you ordered, it'd be nice if they gave you a paper to fill out cause it can be hard getting their attention. 


This was a review and a rant at my bad experience from the other week. But here's my overall summary:


5/10 Customer Service (consistently)
8/10 Quality Of Sushi (some days there have been an "off" taste)

They fixed the rotten egg smell, woohoo !
Not as good as they use to be. I really use to love this place. It's ok but it's just not great anymore .

I've been to almost every sushi spot in Vegas and this isn't at the top of my list. The sushi is good, nothing different than what you get anywhere else. I always get Sashimi so it's fairly standard anywhere. This review is mostly about the service. We didn't care for our server. There are usually two people who wait on you; one who takes your food order and one who does drinks and brings your stuff. The young guy we had was very nice and acknowledged us. The much older short lady was rude. Got forbid she takes your order, she rolls her eyes at you as if you are bothering that you're spending money. 

I doubt we will return. This place is the sister sushi place of Goyemon and that place has MEH service, too.

Buyer beware! We have come here for the past 5 years and yesterday my husband came home with terrible food poisoning! We have always loved this place and would brag about it to everyone we knew. This will be our last time ever coming to this place! I hope the Health Department keeps an eye on this place moving forward
Waited a million years to be seated. Food comes out slow thanks to slow service and wanting to save money on all you can eat sushi.
Salmon Belly and Blue Fin Tuna Nigiri..... yes please!  50 pieces? Wow!

Great sushi and good service!  We went with the all you can eat and ordered almost everything on the menu.

Tip: if you go with the all you can eat, order half rolls so that you can try more things on the menu.

The servers are very attentive and fast.  We will come back for more..

One of the best sushi places I've been to. Very friendly staff and you can tell the chefs know what they're doing cause everything tastes super fresh. Thanks to Ulysses and Zachary for the great experience and service!

My office eats here at least once a week.  Sushi Mon is the clear leader for AYCE.  The chefs, Hiro, Mike and Song are skilled and friendly.  You will love this sushi.  The nigiri is outstanding but the rolls are tasty as well.  Give it a try.  You will be glad you did.

Great stuff and prompt service. Second time going here while in the Vegas area. Had the all you can eat sushi and it did not disappoint. All the food was very good and I would stop back. Parking is strip mall like. Seating is promot and service is good. All items were delicious.

Passing by you might not notice this small restaurant, but it's worth paying attention. The staff are attentive and quick, and most important to me, they never let me run out of water.

Here's why I'll be returning to Sushi Mon in Summerlin:

- Prices are low but the quality of sushi didn't suffer, in fact it was quite good

- You can order half rolls with most of their specialty rolls, allowing you to try more without filling up too quickly

- When filling up quickly isn't a concern, they offer all you can eat, almost all day, for the price of about 2.5 specialty rolls

- Their lychee ice cream was some of the best I've ever had and a wonderful finish to the meal

I have been coming to this location lately instead of Goyemon for my AYCE fix.  My wife and I have dined here five times in the last two months and have never had to wait to be seated which is a nice change of pace.  Servers and Sushi Chefs are all very friendly and greet you with a boisterous "Irasshaimase!" Our favorites include the Hurricane roll, Crispy Rice roll, and Yellowtail Nigiri.

As much as I miss the Silverado location, it's great to have a Sushi Mon closer to the north. The staff is very friendly. Just with the nature of AYCE and random ordering, sometimes items are forgotten but with just a little reminder, you get it instantly. We were turmed away at Sasa. Did us a favor, because it brought us back to our favorite all you can eat place!. Greeted right away, they honor what's written on door for hours of service. Considering that this is all you can eat, the quality of the fish is pretty descent according to my husband. He ate a lot of the special nigiri that they offer. I ate mostly appetizers because I am not really into all you can eat sushi. I do like how they do half orders.
I am not dying to come back though. I am willing to come back if my friends decide to come, but I definitely wouldn't come on my own or reccommend.
The server was nice though.

New listing?  New owner?  Not sure why it's "new," but in the end, it doesn't really matter.  I put my trust in you....wait, got sidetracked for a second....

How's the food???  THAT'S what matters to me!!

Well, as you might have guessed seeing the 5 star review, it's better than good in my book.  It was surprisingly good actually!

I ordered about 15 different kinds of Nigiri.  Not ONE of them were disappointing!  All tasted fresh, but here are some noteworthy ones to touch on :

Uni : Very good Uni! Love the consistency...not watery/runny or overly salty!  I am SUPER particular when it comes to uni...it's the difference between thoroughly enjoying it, or slightly gagging on it at first taste.  Thankfully, it's the former.

Hotate : The Fresh Scallops were PERFECT! Super tender, melt in your mouth good! Buttery, with just a hint of citrus and wasabi of course...only thing I have found to rival it ANYWHERE is YG&S's LIVE counterpart!  And considering that it's not FAIR to compare it, this is the best I've found LOL :P

Amaebi : The sweet shrimp had a slight crunch to it, buttery taste, and smooth finish.  Great choice.  I did not receive the fried heads...you probably need to specify if you want them.

The Hamachi Kama was on the daily special...this is my most favorite part of the fish!  If you see it on the menu and don't mind diggin in for the good stuff, you gotta try the collar if you have been sleeping under a rock!  If you've had it before, you are gonna order it without reading this anyways LOL.

And for dessert, both the Chocolate Mousse and Green Tea Creme Brulee were on daily special.  If you see either on the menu, I would highly recommend both!  Chocolate mousse is a little thicker than their sister stores counterpart, but still that same great taste.  The creme brulee was perfect...strong green tea taste, and I love that crispy crust!

Service was very fast.  They were pretty slow on this Tuesday night, which got me worried about the quality I was to encounter, but I am glad it didn't affect my visit.  But because it was slow, my orders got taken promptly, food was prepared and served quickly, and I always had refills etc.

Only NEGATIVE thing I can think of...I got charged $3 for "sharing" with Little Foodie Dude.  He just turned two, and yes, he DOES have an appetite LOL, but it will mark forever in history as his first charge at an AYCE restaurant.  I'm not too mad though, considering he ate an entire order of Edamame, 4 pieces of unagi, ahi, salmon skin handroll etc lol.  He got his $3 worth :P

I hope it wasn't a fluke, but I much preferred my visit today than the last few times I have been to the Henderson location, as well as the G'monster himself!  All they need now is the Grilled Pork Belly and I'll never have to go back there again lol.

Keep it up Sushi-Mon...keep the ball rollin forward and never look back!

Sushi Mon has two locations in Vegas. This one here in Sahara, and another in Maryland Pkwy (South Vegas). The South Vegas location is the original. Both locations are one of the best AYCE Sushi joints in Vegas. Lunch AYCE is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95. You don't have to get AYCE and can just order like a normal restaurant. But I think the prices for the All you can eat is quite a good deal if you know what to order. The quality of fish is fresh and I never had a Nigiri or roll I didn't like.

Here's the Nigiri you can order in AYCE (not including the special rolls and appetizers you can also get. Each order is 2 pieces of Nigiri.) My favorites being: 1. Salmon ( A very fresh and clean tasting fish. I highly recommend this to first time sushi eaters as it doesn't have any fishy smell and is very smooth. My all time favorite.)
2. Yellowtail ( Classified as a "Luxury fish" Has a rich oily texture. The flesh is light red, A good piece of Yellowtail has very rich flavors. I used to go deep sea fishing for this with my late father. ) 
3. Halibut ( White meat of the sea, Hirame has a very light taste and is delicate. The meat has a soft and chewy texture and lots of flavor. Another fish I used to go deep sea fishing for. Quite an ugly fish if you ever catch one yourself. But one of my favorites by far.
4. Unagi (Grilled Fresh water Eel. Has a rich flavor and should be both crisp and tender. I recommend this fish at the end of the meal as the flavor is strong and may overwhelm your taste buds. You want to start off with the lighter tasting fish to fully enjoy the taste of Sushi.)

You can't go wrong with All You Can Eat at Sushi Mon!  You get 45 minutes of pure indulgence for $21.95 at lunch time.  The sushi rolls are large and taste so good.  Not only do you get sushi rolls you also get hot food options like teriyaki chicken to shrimp tempura to steamed or fried gyoza.  There are cold salad options too.  The main "rule" here is that if you order it you better finish it as you will be charged additional for unfinished rolls.  They have a great half roll option so there should be no issues finishing what you order.  

The service is great and you don't wait long once you start ordering.  We placed our order and within 5 minutes our awesome sushi started rolling out.  The waitress was pleasant and didn't look at us like we were big ol pigs for ordering so much.

The gyoza was fresh with a great filling that included cabbage.  The teriyaki chicken wasn't the best, it's all up to how you like it prepared.  The sushi was on point and there were a ton of sushi rolls to choose from.  The JJ roll and the 007 roll were great and try the royal California roll too.  The supreme Alaska was full of tasty salmon.  Ohhhhh the spicy tuna is the perfect amount of spicy and the Cajun albacore nigiri is great!  Damn me!  I'm hungry for sushi again!!! 

Parking was easy and there is quite a bit of it.  This restaurant is just below Durango on Sahara.  It's in between Cimmaron and  Durango on the north side of the road.  It's in the same parking lot and just a few stores away from Nothing Bundt Cakes.  Paymons is in the same parking lot too.

We walked out beyond full ready to pop from this awesome meal!

This place has a large variety of specialty rolls. We tried half orders of most of the ones with tuna and crab (our favorite kind). The one that stood out was the 911 roll. It was spicy! Great flavor but took us a little by surprise. Try the spider roll also. 

Time limit is 60 min for AYCE but we went a little over and they didn't mind. We were busy talking so the understood. We only reordered once for more food and then of course for dessert. Service was really attentive.

OK.

I went back to Sushi Mon on Monday, and after the service issues I had before, I was very nervous.

Let me just say that my faith has been restored.

The fish was still wonderful, as it always is, but the big improvment for me was the service.

We sat at the bar, and the place was packed.  Our chef was Tony, who was an absolute pleasure.  

We had servers stopping by filling up our water glasses, asking if we wanted anything off the menu with the AYCE.  Everyone was polite and VERY quick.  

No more waiting for 20 minutes for our check!  

Also, they finally updated the website and took down the All you can drink ad that was up there forever.  
I'm a little upset that they still have not replied to the emails I sent them about that, but...it is what it is. 

I feel much better about going to this, my favorite All You Can Eat sushi restaurant since the service improved so much.

I know the quality of AYCE sushi can never match a la carte, but in this case, the AYCE sushi used to be much better.
